title: Senior Embeddedutvecklare
description:
**Senior Embeddedutvecklare till innovativt produktbolag**

 **Företagsbeskrivning:**


Vill du vara med och forma framtidens kommunikationslösningar i ett växande svenskt produktbolag? Hos vår kund får du arbeta i teknikens framkant, med fokus på prestanda, tillförlitlighet och innovation. Här kombineras ett agilt arbetssätt med hög teknisk kompetens och nu söker vi en senior embeddedutvecklare som vill bli en nyckelspelare i teamet. Bolaget är ett svenskt teknikföretag med spetskompetens inom cybersäkerhet, nätverk och kommunikation.

 **Arbetsbeskrivning:**


I rollen som Senior Embeddedutvecklare arbetar du med mjukvaruintegration, hårdvarunära utveckling och systemoptimering inom Linuxbaserade embeddedmiljöer. Du är involverad i hela kedjan – från portning till felsökning och prestandatuning av kommunikationslösningar. Fokus ligger på modemdrivrutiner, VPN-prestanda och stabil systemkommunikation.

  

Du kommer att ingå i ett erfaret, mindre team där samarbete, ansvarstagande och teknisk nyfikenhet står i centrum. Rollen passar dig som är självgående, strukturerad och trivs med att ta ett helhetsgrepp om tekniska utmaningar.

 **Dina arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla och anpassa hårdvarunära mjukvara i Linuxmiljöer
* Porta befintlig mjukvara till nya embedded-plattformar
* Initiera och konfigurera hårdvarukomponenter och drivrutiner
* Felsöka kommunikationsproblem kopplade till modem och radiomoduler
* Optimera prestanda i en VPN-baserad embedded-lösning
* Arbeta med verktyg som Yocto, Buildroot och OpenWRT
* Delta i produktutveckling och bidra med teknisk expertis i hela livscykeln

**Kompetens och erfarenhet:**

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av utveckling i embedded Linux-miljö
* Erfarenhet av open source-byggsystem som Yocto, Buildroot eller OpenWRT
* God förmåga att felsöka hårdvarukomponenter och kommunikationsproblem
* Erfarenhet av produktutveckling inom embedded
* **Du har svenskt medborgarskap samt möjlighet att genomföra säkerhetsprövning**

**Övrig information:**

* Plats:Centrala Stockholm, Hybrid
* Språk: Svenska, och/eller engelska
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse

**Ansökan**


Vårt Talent Acquisition-team ser gärna att du har ett tydligt CV som beskriver tidigare erfarenheter och tekniska kunskaper. Bifoga gärna referenser. Urval sker löpande – skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi värdesätter mångfald och välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter.

  

Vid frågor, kontakta gärna: filip@linden-it.se

title: Mobile Developer
description:
*MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.*


*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.*


*We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.*


*We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day* *and we're looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.*



MAJORITY is looking for a skilled Mobile Developer with experience in both Android and iOS to join our team. to join its team. *This is a full time, in-person position based in Stockholm, Sweden. Developers may work from home up to 2 days a week.*


### **About our mobile apps and MAJORITY**


* The two apps that we work on are native and written entirely in Swift and Kotlin. We also started adopting a bit of SwiftUI on iOS and Compose on Android.
* The development team is up to date with best practices and software patterns on each platform
* To secure high quality code we practice code review and pair programming, we use CI/CD and automated testing
* We always strive to learn new things, so there's room and space for that
* We have great cross team collaboration throughout the entire organization
* We also have a lot of fun together. We have a lunch run club, play foosball and other games, go the gym, AWs etc


**About you and your responsibilities**


* You will work on both platforms in a team that encourages cross-platform expertise and collaboration
* You are ambitious and believe there's always a solution, no matter the complexity of the task ahead of you
* You take pride in the quality of your work. You consider the whole system, cover the edge cases and test your code
* You use AI on a daily basis and strive to find new ways on how it can assist you and your team
* You wake up in the morning with positive energy to bring to work where you will collaborate with your colleagues and contribute to the organizational success
* You are able to reason through the trade-offs and dare to make decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have a keen interest in architecture and know how to build complex applications that are maintainable
* You love to share the knowledge you have and to learn new things from your colleagues and other sources
* You are interested in learning new technologies

### **Basic Requirements**


* Good experience in iOS and Android app development. Mainly worked with Swift and Kotlin.
* Knowledgeable about iOS, Android, Google, Apple, mobile, devices and related spheres of technology
* Excellent communication skills in English, some Spanish is a plus

### **Ideal candidate**


* 6+ years full-time professional iOS and Android development experience, with a balanced distribution in both areas
* Committed to writing excellent code
* Experience working with a growing team on evolving products with many users
* Experience building new products with an eye on maintainability and scalability
* Experience with payment platforms, FinTech, Banking or app security
* Happy hacking on new technology, loves R&D
* Always curious, always learning
* Vision for product development and for how a code base evolves
* A degree in computer science
* A pleasure to work with


**If you're interested in joining our mission as a Mobile Developer, please apply by submitting your CV.**


*We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**About Evam:**  

Evam is revolutionizing the future of public safety technology. Although we are in the early stages of our growth journey, we already play a crucial role in the public safety network, protecting over 10 million citizens across the UK and the Nordics. With a proven product, we are now expanding into new markets, aiming to enhance the efficiency of first responder organizations and, ultimately, safeguard our society.
  
  

**Role Overview:**  

As a hands-on developer with at least 5 years of relevant experience, you’ll play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining our platform. Ensuring it remains stable, scalable, and responsive even in the most demanding environments. You’ll work with modern technologies like React (TypeScript) on the frontend and Spring Boot 3 on the backend.
  
  

We’re looking for someone who is not only technically strong but also thrives in a collaborative environment, takes ownership, and isn’t afraid to dive into complex problems. You’re curious by nature, proactive in your approach, and care deeply about the quality of the software you build. Experience in team leadership and architecture design is a strong plus, as this role may include guiding others and contributing to high-level technical decisions.
  
  

This is more than just coding – it’s about building robust, real-time solutions that first responders can rely on when lives are on the line. You’ll collaborate closely with our development and support teams, turning user feedback and frontline insights into features that make a real difference.
  
  

SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS
  
  

**What you’ll bring:**  

Senior-level experience in full stack development (minimum 5 years)
  
Strong skills in React with TypeScript (must-have)
  
Experience with Spring Boot 3 or similar backend frameworks (preferred)
  
Solid understanding of modern web and mobile application development
  
Experience in leading teams and contributing to architectural design is a big plus
  
Passion for building resilient, production-grade systems
  
Motivation to work on software that has a real-world impact, globally
  
A strong sense of ownership and pride in your work
  
A proactive, solution-oriented mindset
  
Great communication skills and a collaborative spirit
  
Motivation to build high-impact, production-grade systems for critical use cases
  
  

**Salary:** 50,000–65,000 SEK/month, depending on experience and qualifications.
  
  

Join us and help shape the future of emergency response technology. Where your code truly matters.
  
  

GREAT PLACE TO WORK
  
  

Flexible working conditions
  
  

Personal development
  
  

Inclusive culture
  
  

Work with the latest technologies without legacy
  
  

Choose your own tools
  
  

Good retirement benefits
  
  

Health care allowance
  
  

ABOUT THE COMPANY
  
  

Evam is revolutionizing the future of public safety technology. Although we are in the early stages of our growth journey, we already play a crucial role in the public safety network, protecting over 10 million citizens across the UK and the Nordics. With a proven product, we are now expanding into new markets, aiming to enhance the efficiency of first responder organizations and, ultimately, safeguard our society.
  
  

Florian Curinga | Contact Person

title: Baseband Developer
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden
Job ID**770359**
Join our Team **About this opportunity:**


Are you ready to shape the future of 5G?  

  

Within the L1 Software Development team in the Product Engineering Group RU Baseband Software, we are dedicated to designing and implementing Physical Layer Baseband functions for our Radio products. Our goal is to maintain Ericsson’s leadership in the market by delivering cutting-edge L1 solutions across diverse deployment scenarios, frequency bands, radio platforms and 3GPP/ORAN standards.  

  

We are currently looking for a L1 Software Developer to join our outstanding team in Kista. In this role, you’ll be working on our 5G/6G RAN L1 Software product, playing a key role in ensuring its performance and success.  

  

Join us at the forefront of wireless innovation!

 **What you will do:**


As a member of the L1 team, you’ll shape system architecture, implement key features, and ensure high-performance deployment. Your focus will be on the Physical Layer (L1) components of Baseband software—core building blocks of our leading 5G RAN solutions and future 6G technologies.

* Collaborate with engineers to design/systemize, develop, and maintain software components essential to product functionality.
* Enhance existing features and develop new ones, with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability—leveraging Ericsson’s evolving Multi-Core Architecture Platform.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Troubleshoot and resolve software issues to ensure seamless operation.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.
* Work within a dynamic, agile development environment to meet timelines and goals.
 **Skills You Bring:**

* Passion and interest in design, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and a solid and proven expertise in embedded software design.
* Expertise in multi-core architectures and real-time systems.
* Domain knowledge in wireless communications, especially in signal processing, 4G/5G NR Physical Layer functions (highly desirable).
* Strong collaboration skills – thrive in international, multi-site teams; open communicator with a proactive, can-do attitude.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, agile environments; committed to delivering high-quality software on time.
* A drive for innovation – proactive mindset for continuous improvement in development practices.
* Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communications, or a related field.
* Relevant experience, 2–6 years in embedded software development, ideally in telecom or a related industry
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Systemutvecklare Java – Jönköping
description:
Har du erfarenhet av Javautveckling och trivs i agila team där du får arbeta både med nyutveckling och förvaltning? Vi på Aveer söker nu en senior Javautvecklare till ett uppdrag med fokus på moderna verksamhetssystem.
  
Om rollenDu kommer att arbeta i ett tekniktungt och verksamhetsnära uppdrag med ansvar för både utveckling och förvaltning av kundens verksamhetssystem. De flesta systemen är egenutvecklade och bygger på Java och Oracle, med en utvecklingsplattform anpassad för myndighetsmiljö.
  
Uppdraget omfattar bland annat systemdesign, backend- och frontendutveckling samt test och leverans, i nära samarbete med andra utvecklare, verksamhetsrepresentanter och produktteam.
  
Här erbjuds du ett uppdrag med stort tekniskt djup, möjlighet att påverka arkitektur och arbetssätt samt en kultur som uppmuntrar kunskapsdelning och samarbete.
  
**I rollen kommer du bland annat att:** Utveckla fullstacklösningar med Java (Java EE) och Angular
  
Arbeta med PostgreSQL och JPA/Hibernate
  
Delta i design och förbättring av verksamhetssystem
  
Bidra till ett agilt team som arbetar enligt Scrum
  
Följa krav för digital tillgänglighet enligt standarden EN301 549
  
**Vi söker dig som har:** Minst 10 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Java och TypeScript
  
Djup kompetens inom Java EE, GIT, systemdesign och agilt arbetssätt
  
Erfarenhet av PostgreSQL och frontendutveckling i Angular
  
Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och bidra till teamets gemensamma mål
  
**Meriterande erfarenheter:** Utveckling av administrativa system
  
Domändriven design (DDD)
  
Erfarenhet av Jira, Jenkins, Kubernetes och REST
  
Kunskap inom BDD/TDD och teststrategier
  
Möjlighet att arbeta 100 % på plats i Jönköping
  
**Övrig information:** Placeringsort: Jönköping (Hybrid)

title: Systemadministratör/Systemutvecklare till IT-avdelning!
description:
Vi söker en serviceinriktad systemadministratör/systemutvecklare till Gamla Uppsala Buss. Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med varierade arbetsuppgifter inom IT i ett företag med stor samhällsnytta. Du kommer att tillhöra IT-avdelningen som idag består av fyra medarbetare varav en IT-chef, två systemadministratörer samt en IT-support.


**Arbetsuppgifter**



Som systemadministratör kommer du att arbeta med installation och administration av servrar och nätverk, programmering, installation av arbetsstationer och intern IT-support. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med samtliga avdelningar där du agerar stöd i IT-relaterade frågor. Du kommer arbeta med projekt för att utveckla applikationer för intern användning och på så vis vara en viktig del i företagets IT-utveckling.



Exempel på arbetsområden:  

* Intern IT-support
* Serverdrift
* SQL-databaser
* Scripting
* Programmering (exempelvis API:er och webbapplikationer)
* BI/dataanalys
* AI/ML
* IT-säkerhet

**Kravprofil**  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning i systemvetenskap/datavetenskap eller motsvarande kompetens hämtad från arbetslivet
* Goda kunskaper i Windows
* Grundläggande förståelse och kännedom om nätverk
* Goda kunskaper i svenska
* Körkort B


Kunskaper inom programmering (gärna C# eller Java), scriptspråk, Active Directory, Microsoft 365, PowerBI, virtualisering (VMware eller Hyper-V) samt SQL-databaser är mycket meriterande.


**Vem är du?**



Vi tror att du är i början av din karriär och är redo för att ta nästa steg inom ett företag med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi söker dig som har ett genuint intresse för IT- och systemfrågor och som trivs med varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi tror att du är en person som har lätt för att ta kontakt med människor och bra på att samarbeta tätt ihop med andra.



Som person är du serviceinriktad, prestigelös och bra på att snabbt sätta dig in i olika sammanhang. Du har en flexibel inställning och kan ta dig an varierande arbetsuppgifter från dag till dag. Du är en lagspelare som trivs att arbeta tätt tillsammans med ett team som arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Vidare är du pedagogiskt lagd, bra på att ta egna initiativ och lösa problem.


**Om tjänsten**  

  

Tillsvidareanställning med 6 mån provanställning / Heltid / Uppsala


*Arbetstider*: måndag - fredag, kontorstider med viss flextid.



Schemalagd beredskap dygnet runt gäller cirka 10-15 veckor per år med beredskap i hemmet eller annan plats som överenskommits.



Tillträdesdag efter överenskommelse.


**Rekryteringsprocessen**



Sista ansökningsdag 2025-08-24. Rekrytering sker löpande och rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.



Har du frågor så är du välkommen att kontakta:  

Martin Pless, IT-chef, 018-444 58 55  

Facklig representant, vision\_fortroendevalda@gub.se


**Om företaget**



Gamla Uppsala Buss är ett av Sveriges största offentligt ägda bussföretag och ägs idag av Region Uppsala. Vårt huvudsakliga uppdrag är att bedriva Uppsalas stadsbusstrafik. GUB har även egen verkstad med tillhörande servicehall, hållplatsservice samt egen utbildning för bussförare. Företaget är beläget i centrala Uppsala och har ungefär 600 anställda.



Som anställd hos GUB blir du en del av ett glatt gäng där din kompetens gör nytta. Företaget erbjuder kompetensutveckling, förmånliga personalaktiviteter såsom utbildningar, friskvård och aktivitetsdagar.

title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) Developer
description:
About the job
  
  

**Job Title:** Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) Developer
  
  

**Location:** Telia, Solna – Stockholm, Sweden
  
  

**Start Date:** Immediate joiners preferred
  
  

**Employment Type:** Full-time
  
  

**Job Description:**  

We are currently seeking an experienced Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer to join a
  
  

dynamic team at our client’s location in Stockholm. This is an urgent requirement, and we are
  
  

looking for candidates who can join immediately.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Develop, customize, and optimize solutions on Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC)
  
  

Design and implement personalized, automated customer journeys using Email Studio,
  
  

Journey Builder, Automation Studio, and related tools
  
  

Work closely with MarTech and marketing teams to translate business requirements
  
  

into technical solutions
  
  

Integrate SFMC with other systems and CDPs (Customer Data Platforms) as needed
  
  

Manage data flows, segmentation, and report for marketing campaigns
  
  

Maintain best practices in code, architecture, and data security
  
  

**Required Skills:**  

Proven hands-on experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  
  

Strong understanding of MarTech ecosystems and marketing automation tools
  
  

Experience working with CDPs and integrating data into SFMC
  
  

Proficiency in AMPscript, SQL, and HTML/CSS for email development
  
  

Knowledge of REST/SOAP APIs for system integration
  
  

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  
  

**Nice to Have:**  

Salesforce certifications (e.g., Marketing Cloud Developer, Marketing Cloud Email
  
  

Specialist)
  
  

Experience with additional Salesforce modules (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud) is a plus
  
  

**Additional Information:**  

On-site presence in Solna (Stockholm) is expected
  
  

Immediate availability is a strong advantage
  
  

Interested?
  
  

If you’re ready to be part of the Celsus Engineering AB Part of Ultra Group AB team and journey
  
  

where your passion for Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) Developer aligns with our mission,
  
  

we invite you to join us, make a difference, develop yourself, and have fun!
  
  

Sounds interesting? We hope so. Apply for the job!

title: Tech lead/Architect Developer Experience (DevEx)
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
If you're passionate about modern software delivery, thrive on optimizing the DevOps cycle, and want to shape the future of engineering at scale, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Drive Developer Experience for a community of 2500+ engineers, supporting thousands of builds daily—and scaling for more.
* Lead technical direction across multiple engineering teams focused on CI/CD orchestration, source control systems, and collaboration tools.
* Design and maintain scalable system architecture for source control platforms, ensuring performance, security, and compliance across the development lifecycle.
* Champion engineering excellence, embedding quality engineering principles, continuous improvement, and innovation into everything we build.
* Lead migration efforts from legacy systems to modern platforms, ensuring minimal disruption and data integrity.
* Mentor and guide teams in source control best practices, code quality, and platform usage—fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience—what matters most is your impact and expertise.
* 10+ years of software development experience and 3-5 years of experience as a Tech Lead or Solution Architect, with a strong foundation in software engineering.
* A hands-on leader who experiments with emerging tools and frameworks, while also shaping long-term architectural vision.
* A growth mindset and strong leadership skills—able to mentor, inspire, and foster an inclusive, collaborative culture.
* Excellent communication skills, capable of translating complex technical ideas into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders.
* Technical expertise we value:
+ Programming languages: Java, JavaScript, Python
+ Cloud platforms: Azure, AWS
+ Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes (AKS, OpenShift)
+ CI/CD tooling: Jenkins, GitHub Actions
+ Secure SDLC: Integrating security and compliance into all phases of development
+ Developer portals: homegrown, Backstage.io
+ Modern engineering practices: Agile, DevOps, and platform engineering with a focus on improving developer experience


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 contribute to our
 **Tech for Engineering** 
 unit that empowers over 250 development teams to deliver business value faster and with confidence. We build the internal platforms, tools, and services that streamline the software delivery lifecycle—from commit to production. At the heart of our mission is automation, quality engineering, and an exceptional developer experience.
   

  

 As your future manager, I bring clarity, energy, and a deep belief in people. I foster a collaborative, inclusive culture where structure supports—not stifles—innovation. I value practical solutions, open dialogue, and a shared commitment to continuous improvement. If you're driven by impact, enjoy smart teamwork, and want to grow in a supportive, high-performing environment, we’ll get along great."

**your future manager**

title: Senior Developer – Connected Autonomous Systems
description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated senior developer to join a team focused on advancing the connectivity framework for autonomous transport technologies. The role involves shaping and maintaining secure, high-performance communication between autonomous vehicles and external infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on cloud integration, security, and observability.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Connectivity Platform Development: Design and implement a robust communication layer enabling secure and reliable data exchange between cloud environments and onboard vehicle systems.
* Identity & Access Management: Oversee certificate-based authentication and authorization to ensure unique identities and strict access policies for each autonomous vehicle unit.
* Telemetry & Performance Metrics: Develop telemetry pipelines to transmit connectivity data, latency figures, and vehicle statistics to cloud services.
* Monitoring & Diagnostics: Integrate comprehensive observability tools such as Grafana and Databricks for real-time insights, and automate operational procedures to minimize downtime and speed up issue resolution.
* Security Implementation: Apply modern security practices including encryption and access control, and manage ongoing updates to mitigate vulnerabilities.
* Deployment Tooling: Build and optimize deployment tools for efficient system rollout and scaling.
* Efficient OTA Distribution: Engineer bandwidth-aware over-the-air update strategies for large file transfers.
* Real-Time Data Flow: Enable smooth, low-latency communication for continuous updates between vehicles and cloud systems.


**Required Qualifications**
* Professional Experience: At least 5 years in a similar development or cloud-connected systems role.
* Cloud Expertise: Proven hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), including cloud-native design and deployment.
* Programming Skills: Strong proficiency in Kotlin. Experience in C++ is advantageous.
* Communication Protocols: Solid working knowledge of gRPC. Familiarity with Kafka is a plus.
* Modern Development Practices: Experience with serverless architectures, containerization using Docker and Kubernetes.
* Infrastructure Automation: Competence in infrastructure-as-code using tools like CloudFormation.
* Data Management: Working knowledge of DynamoDB or similar NoSQL databases.
* Security Acumen: Practical understanding of secure system design, including encryption and policy-based access.
* Agile and CI/CD: Experience working in agile teams with continuous integration and deployment workflows.


**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Assignment: Lead Data Platform Engineer
description:
We are currently looking for a skilled and hands-on Lead Data Platform Engineer to take a central role in the development of a modern, self-serve data platform. The aim is to enable product and engineering teams to independently manage, publish, and consume high-quality datasets — all within a decentralized architecture inspired by data mesh principles. This platform will support autonomy while maintaining shared standards for consistency and interoperability.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 In this role, you will be instrumental in shaping the architecture and infrastructure of the data platform. You’ll design and implement foundational components, make thoughtful technology decisions, and work collaboratively across engineering, infrastructure, and platform teams to create a scalable and user-friendly environment for data management.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who enjoys both hands-on development and strategic thinking — someone who can write code, tackle integration challenges, and help define long-term direction for the platform.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Architect and implement essential platform elements including dataset catalogs, publishing SDKs, metadata management, orchestration tools, and storage standards
* Integrate open-source technologies such as Flyte, Dagster, DataHub, or Amundsen
* Define and enforce best practices for dataset formats (e.g., Parquet), schema management, versioning, and access control
* Shape how Databricks fits within the broader platform ecosystem
* Contribute to the standardization of how teams produce and consume datasets
* Build a platform that is extensible, observable, and intuitive to use for development teams


**Ideal Background**
* 7+ years of software engineering experience, with a focus on data-centric systems or internal platforms
* Practical experience with data orchestration tools like Airflow, Flyte, or Dagster
* Strong familiarity with cloud services — Azure preferred, but AWS or GCP is also valuable
* Comfortable using Databricks and its ecosystem in production environments
* Solid understanding of metadata, lineage, and data ownership principles
* Background in developing internal tools, shared services, or engineering platforms
* Proficiency in Python and CLI tools, with working knowledge of SQL
* A pragmatic mindset — you prioritize impact, iterate quickly, and value simplicity over perfection
* Excellent communication skills and a collaborative approach across teams


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Experience with Delta Lake and lakehouse architecture
* Knowledge of tools like Power BI, Backstage, or open metadata catalog platforms
* Previous roles in data engineering, developer experience, or infrastructure operations


**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about automation, infrastructure, and streamlining development workflows? We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer to join a growing digital company working with high-impact clients across Sweden.
 



  





 As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll be part of a cross-functional team that supports developers and product owners with the tools, infrastructure, and processes needed to deliver high-quality solutions at speed. You'll play a key role in maintaining and evolving CI/CD pipelines, improving developer experience, and ensuring secure, scalable cloud infrastructure.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Manage and improve CI/CD pipelines for multiple development teams
* Work closely with developers to support cloud-native application deployments
* Automate infrastructure provisioning and maintenance
* Improve observability and monitoring of systems and services
* Drive security best practices within infrastructure and workflows
* Collaborate with the team to shape our DevOps strategy and tooling



  





**Tech Stack** 




 We work with a modern, flexible tech stack including:
 


* Cloud: AWS
* Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes
* CI/CD
* Terraform
* Monitoring: Datadog
* Scripting: Python, Bash



  





**Who You Are** 



* You have hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure
* You’re comfortable writing Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform)
* You understand CI/CD workflows and modern DevOps tooling
* You enjoy collaborating with developers and supporting agile teams
* You’re curious, pragmatic, and eager to improve how things are done
* Fluent in Swedish and English speaking



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with GitHub Actions or similar CI tools
* Knowledge of networking, container orchestration, or security practices
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and working in cross-functional teams



  





 You’ll be part of a close-knit team that values innovation, transparency, and continuous improvement. They offer a strong tech culture, flexible work setup, and a genuine passion for building great digital products. You’ll also get to work on projects that make a real impact whether in public services, sustainability, or digital transformation.

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**As a Senior Android Engineer** 
 , you will play a key role in the
 **Infrastructure team** 
 by improving developer experience, building and maintaining internal tools, ensuring CI/CD stability and efficiency and guiding app architecture. You will collaborate directly with backend and data infrastructure teams to build and enhance engineering platforms. As this role is primarily infrastructure-focused, your work will center around internal systems and tooling, rather than UI development or feature delivery within the app.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Collaborate with other developers, data analysts and release managers to design, build and maintain robust infrastructure and tooling that boosts productivity of our Android engineering teams.
* Take full ownership of the Android developer experience, continuously evolving it by building and maintaining internal libraries, Gradle plugins and optimizing our CI/CD pipelines.
* Develop automation solutions that eliminate repetitive manual tasks for developers, freeing them to focus on feature development.
* Identify & execute large tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
* Set and maintain high engineering standards, ensuring infrastructure consistently meets developer needs.
* Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* 5+ years of experience in Android development.
* Strong passion for enhancing the developer experience, building internal tooling and reducing developer friction.
* Ability to work independently, proactively identify problems and autonomously drive your own work from conception to completion. You are expected to be a self-starter and take initiative.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to diagnose complex technical issues and propose effective solutions.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Excellent communication skills in English.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience with build and CI/CD systems, particularly Gradle and GitHub Actions.
* Experience with building Gradle plugins.
* Experience with building internal tools.
* Experience in investigating ANRs and analyzing bug reports. Analytical skills for finding root causes of crashes and other critical issues.
* Experience in debugging and profiling Android applications.
* Experience presenting on technical topics or advocating for best practices within an engineering organization.


**Life at Truecaller** 
 - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
   

  

**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. We are excited to hear from you, don’t hesitate to apply!
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We only accept applications in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: Senior Solutions Architect, AWS Telco Business Unit
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a technical leader to help global telecommunications service providers transform their businesses with AWS cloud and generative AI technologies. AWS Solutions Architects work on the most complex customer challenges and opportunities, leading in defining technical strategies and developing our own capabilities.
   

  

 The problem domains are diverse: 5G monetization, network function virtualization, digital customer journeys, OSS/BSS transformation, mobile edge computing, hyperscale data and cybersecurity. At your disposal is the breadth of AWS, including GenAI, classical AI/ML, edge computing, IoT, and data analytics.
   

  

 As part of the Telecommunications Solutions Architecture team, you will collaborate with customers, internal AWS teams, and AWS partners to deliver solutions to the unique challenges faced by telecom customers. You will be the single-threaded owner of the AWS technology strategy for your customer(s) and account team(s) to drive AWS adoption. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value while assessing risks, balancing trade-offs, and encouraging risk-tasking to maximize your customer's business value of AWS is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think long-term about business, product, and technical outcomes.
   

  

 Our team is small and motivated. We come from diverse backgrounds, but what we all have in common is a huge curiosity, a passion for delighting our customers, and a desire to deliver technology that transforms their business.
   

  

 What’s it like to work at AWS? Our team experiences high levels of collaboration, lots of multi-tasking, and often course corrections or new ideas that mean adaptability is key. We find creative and scalable solutions to our customers’ difficult problems, and we own delivering those outcomes to the customer. We are also a geographically-distributed team, which means you will need to possess a high bias for taking action without immediate team consensus.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work on the most complex customer challenges and opportunities. They have a leading role in developing both the strategy and the team itself. They combine an informed view of the market with their understanding of emerging technology trends to speed-up innovation across their customer segment. Externally, they are recognized thought leaders and influence the strategy of our customers. Internally, they earn a reputation of role models and deliver bar-raising guidance to the broader Solutions Architecture team.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to invent cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
   

  

 You will take a leading role in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology and industry trends (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
   

  

 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.
   

  

 This role is within the EMEA Telco organization and you would be working with large Telco customers.
   

  

 Role requires domestic and international (mainly Europe) travel up to 30%.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The AWS Industries team is committed to helping industry customers enable their digital transformation journeys. Our primary goal is to meet customers in their cloud journeys and work backwards from their industry-specific needs to transform their businesses and industries. Our team focuses on business outcomes and industry use cases on behalf of our customers, whether that is how we build products and solutions, how we sell, how we deliver, or how we partner.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent
* Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries
* Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
* Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
* Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in infrastructure architecture, databases, and networking across regulated industries
* Experience working with developer communities and understanding their needs
* Deep knowledge of AWS services, solutions architecture, and operational excellence
* Understanding of market segments, customer bases, and industry verticals
* Proficiency with software development methodologies and tooling


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3040941

title: Engineering Team Lead, Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Storage Access Abstractions team bridges the gap between Product Engineering’s evolving needs and infrastructure capabilities by building database-
 **agnostic, developer-friendly APIs** 
 that simplify access to online data at scale. Our mission is to enable product engineers to focus on solving business problems by providing a
 **seamless and intuitive stateful data access layer** 
 , without needing to manage the complexity of robust, secure, and high-performance storage primitives.
   

  

 We’re currently building the next generation online data storage abstraction layers on top of scalable distributed databases (including Cassandra) to serve engineers across Doordash + Wolt globally. The team is at a pivotal phase, transitioning from architectural design and deep development to taking the first steps towards production readiness. We are just getting started, and there is still a lot to build and define, both in shaping the team and the product!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re now hiring an Engineering Manager to lead building next-generation storage access abstraction layers. You will lead a team of highly skilled engineers in designing, building and optimizing the new platform and ensuring smooth developer onboarding, constant improvement and optimization. Doordash and Wolt operate at significant scale and are growing rapidly: performance, availability and scalability are central to the team's work.
   

  

 Your team will be responsible for building and maintaining an abstraction layer in front of distributed storage systems, ensuring high availability, performance, and reliability. You will help shape the future of storage abstraction, driving innovation in database efficiency, fault tolerance, and operational simplicity, allowing engineers across DoorDash and Wolt to focus on delivering great product experiences. You will collaborate with infrastructure and product engineers across global teams, including those in the US and EU timezones, to ensure the platform meets their evolving storage and scalability needs.
   

  

 You will report to the Director of the Core Group in Wolt’s Product Organization, collaborating closely with our peers at Doordash.
   

  

 You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…
   

  

* Lead and mentor a team of senior engineers focused on scaling and optimizing distributed databases and abstractions.
* Drive architectural decisions for high-performance, fault-tolerant data abstractions built on top of NoSQL databases (e.g., Cassandra).
* Collaborate cross-functionally with platform, infrastructure, and application teams to ensure seamless data access, consistency, and reliability.
* Facilitate stakeholder management and build a relationship with our customers internally spanning across timezones.
* Bring expertise in building and operating high scale systems and open source softwares with a focus on reliability, scalability, efficiency and ease of use
* Build, sustain, and grow a diverse team to address the growing needs of the organization


 We’re excited about you because…
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience in backend/infrastructure engineering, with 2+ years leading engineering teams.
* You have hands-on experience with one or more large-scale databases ( Cassandra, DynamoDB, or similar).
* You have a strong track record of hiring, onboarding, and mentoring Senior Engineers.
* You excel in technical leadership, providing guidance in architecture decisions, performance improvements, and team growth.
* You are execution-driven, with a proven ability to deliver large-scale distributed storage solutions in fast-moving environments.
* You treat infrastructure as a product — obsess over the developer experience, ensure the platform is intuitive, easy to adopt and delivers measurable value to internal customers.
* You champion a culture of customer obsession and feedback-driven development, ensuring the team deeply understands and responds to the needs of engineers relying on the platform.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Solutions Consultant
description:
**Job Description:**
 Are you a tech-savvy problem-solver who loves turning big ideas into workable plans and can explain complex tech in plain language? Do you thrive at the intersection of business goals, user experience, and engineering? Then you may be our next Solution Consultant at Merkle!
   

  

 As Solution Consultant, you’ll be part of our Merkle Growth team doing pre-sales efforts and act as a Subject matter expert in our project deliveries.  You’ll guide clients from first conversation to delivery hand-off, shaping solutions that are feasible, scalable, and aligned with business objectives.
   

  

 The position calls for strong analytical thinking, technical experience, clear communication, and a genuine interest in modern content platforms (Sitecore, Optimizely, Adobe, WordPress, and headless stacks) as well as related systems and integrations (e.g. DAM, eCommerce platforms inc. PIM / 3PL integrations, personalization engines to name a few).
   

  

 Your curiosity extends well beyond CMSs – you closely monitor the AI space and have an interest in cloud-native architecture and technological frameworks, always eager to translate them into real-world solutions applicable for our clients.
   

  

 You will work closely with UX/UI designers, developers, project managers, and client directors, data & analysts — all with the aim of creating digital experiences that delight users and drive results.
   

  

**Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include**
* Translating our clients’ business and experience goals into clear technical requirements and roadmaps
* Leading discovery workshops and scoping sessions, breaking work into manageable pieces
* Producing effort estimates, timelines, and high-level architecture diagrams that are relevant to stakeholders can understand
* Acting as a trusted advisor during RFPs and pitches, explaining our proposed approach in a concise, compelling way
* Spotting risks and dependencies early and communicating them clearly to stakeholders
* Acting as a client-facing SME, working with developers and architects to explain to stakeholders how changing requirements impact solution feasibility.
* Staying up to date on technology trends and platform capabilities, integration patterns, and best practices to guide your recommendations


  

  

**For this role, we are looking for someone who has** 
  

  

* 3–6 years of experience as a technical project manager, senior developer, or similar hybrid role
* Experience in an advisory role and stakeholder management is required, ideally from a consultancy, agency, or software company.
* Demonstrated experience in pre-sales activities
* Hands-on experience with at least one modern DXP or CMS (for example Sitecore, Optimizely, Adobe, WordPress, or headless)
* Experience with cloud-based solutions such as AWS, Azure & GCP
* A solid grasp of agile ways of working and related tools (such as JIRA, DevOps, Confluence)
* A track record of turning fuzzy requirements into clear statements of work and estimates
* Experience in presenting to both senior executives and delivery teams, adjusting the level of detail and language as needed
* Fluency in English and Swedish


  

  

**Benefits**
* A great office in Stockholm
* Amazing colleagues who are experts in everything digital
* The flexibility and the best of both worlds – to work from home and the office.
* Excellent career opportunities within both Merkle and Dentsu
* The possibility to work with large, international clients in cross-market teams
* 30 vacation days and 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* Incentives connected to well-being and personal development
* A strong, open culture with several events, after-works, and happenings yearly


  

  

**About Merkle**
 Merkle is a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation agency. We partner with Top 500 companies in the Northern European region. Our Merkle NE cluster consists of four markets: Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and the Netherlands, and we operate as one unified, leading full-service digital agency to serve our Nordic markets.
   

  

 Our 700+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built by providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, and CMS. Merkle is a part of dentsu, a global network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.
   

  

**How to apply** 
  

  

 Click Apply and upload your CV or an updated LinkedIn profile. There is no application deadline; finding the right candidate is more important to us than a speedy process. We remove the job ad when filling the position. If you have any questions, please reach out to our Senior Talent Acquisition Partner, Tine Moe, at tine.moe@merkle.com
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Merkle
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: 2x Data Engineers
description:
We are looking for 2 experienced Data Engineers that will join the client's Data Processing product area, to help us increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms, all while maintaining our global cloud cost efficiency. You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers the teams to process data to solve critical business needs.
   

  

 WHAT YOU'LL DO:
   

  

* Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
* Help scale the new platform to reach targets that ensure the painless and seamless migration of data pipelines from all across the company to the new stack.
* Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in the company to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.


 WHO YOU ARE:
   

  

* You are an experienced Data Engineer, also proficient in backend development using Java.
* You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
* You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
* Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
* You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
* You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
* Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
* You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
* You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
* You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.


 Period: 2025-08-18 to 2025-12-31

title: 🚀 Multiply is hiring – Senior Full-Stack Developer (Kotlin-first)
description:
📍 Hybrid (Stockholm) | 💼 Full-time | 🔧 Industrial & Embedded Focus
 



 We’re looking for a
 **senior developer** 
 with strong
 **Kotlin** 
 skills and solid experience in
 **.NET/C#** 
 ,

 , and

 **VisFlow** 
 .

 * Kotlin & .NET backend services (Microservices, gRPC, Event-Driven)
* React/TypeScript UIs
* AWS (Lambda, ECS, S3), Docker, Kubernetes
* Embedded system integration (vehicle/IoT context)

 What we’re looking for:
 * 3+ yrs Kotlin (or Java w/ Kotlin exposure)
* 5+ yrs .NET/C#
* 3+ yrs React/TypeScript
* Strong AWS & DevOps skills
* Fluent English, hybrid in Stockholm (2–3 days onsite)



 Join a team where you can
 **shape product** 
 ,
 **build cool tech** 
 , and grow in a
 **flat, visionary company** 
 .
 



 📩 Apply now or DM us to learn more!
 


* #kotlin #fullstackdeveloper #aws #reactjs #embedded #scania #dotnet #jobsearch #stockholmjobs #techjobs #multiplytech #visflow

title: Java Developer
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet** 




 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,000+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us!
 



  





**The role:** 




 We are looking for an experienced Java Developer to join our team in Sweden. We maintain and develop several business-critical applications built on Java, .NET, and SQL Server. As we move toward a unified, modern architecture in Java and AWS, we need a help to drive technical improvements, support the team, and promote best practices in software development and agile collaboration.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Hands-On Development** 
 : Design, build, and refactor systems into containerized microservices running in cloud.
* **Handle critical maintenance & support in both modern and legacy** 
 : Handle incidents in production systems with technical investigations and solutions.
* **Drive Modernization** 
 : Contribute to the strategy and execution of transforming legacy applications into modern cloud solutions.
* **Support the Team** 
 : Share knowledge, promote modern software development practices, and encourage team collaboration.
* **Advocate for Best Practices** 
 : Implement clean code principles, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker).



  





**Who You Are:** 



* Around 5 years of experience with Java and microservices development.
* Exposure to legacy systems (e.g., .NET and relational databases like SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB).
* Proficiency with Docker and experience building containerized applications.
* Familiarity with Spring Boot framework and AWS cloud services.
* Well-oriented and comfortable working on Linux on-prem servers.



  





**Team and Collaboration** 
 :
 


* Ability to work effectively in a team environment, sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues.
* Experience working with agile processes and a collaborative mindset.



  





**Mindset** 
 :
 


* Passion for system modernization, solving technical challenges and improving processes.
* Willingness to bridge the gap between legacy systems and modern software solutions.



  




* Fluent in both
 **English and Swedish** 
 language.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 At Dun & Bradstreet, we’re more than just data and analytics. We’re building a workplace where diverse ideas flourish, personal development is prioritized, and every team member is empowered to make a difference.

title: Full-stack Developer, Policy Edit and Multi Vehicle
description:
Are you a Full-Stack .NET developer who wants to create the smartest solutions for our users? We are looking for Full-stack .NET developers who want to be part of a Tribe responsible for developing and maintaining one of the company’s biggest core systems.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a full-stack .NET Developer, you will be part of a distributed squad with colleagues from across the Nordics and the Baltics. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to actively contribute and influence decisions in your squad, delivering solutions that impact a very large number of users and customers. At Waypoint, you’ll also have the chance to work closely with technical and domain experts, developers, quality engineers, architects, and analysts — both within and outside your squad. There are great opportunities to continue growing as a full-stack developer or to explore paths into management or architecture.
   

  

**About Waypoint And Our Squads**
 We have built our digital platform, Waypoint, from scratch—a unified solution for all services and business areas, utilizing modern technology. Waypoint is one of the Nordic region's largest .NET products. Every day, we focus on finding smarter solutions for our customers and ourselves. We are a team of over 150 people working in 12 cross-functional, independent squads to deliver a stable, scalable, and secure insurance platform. Waypoint is a complex and exciting system, continuously in need of skilled and committed individuals. This is where you come in.
   

  

 As a squad member in Policy Edit, you’ll contribute to digital solutions that support insurance purchase and editing processes for Swedish private customers. The team focuses on enabling seamless digital flows through integrations for cases requiring additional steps like eHD or pre-payment, helping both customers and frontliners manage policies efficiently. The squad consists of developers, QA, and business roles located in Riga, Stockholm, and Oslo.
   

  

 As a squad member in MultiVehicle you will take part of developing and maintaining a modern solution tailored for If’s commercial segment for automatically insuring the customers’ vehicles. The MultiVehicle squad consists of developers, architect and QA`s, located in Stockholm, Oslo and Riga.
   

  

 Who are you?
   

  

 We are looking for a driven full-stack developer with experience in both back-end and front-end development who wants to create fast and durable solutions that are user friendly. You see knowledge-sharing as a natural part of your work. You are also a team player with a natural appetite for learning new things and challenge yourself. Additionally, you are service minded and happy support both squad members and stakeholders.
   

  

 You also have:
   

  

* Experience with .NET, C# and Message based solutions
* Relevant education or IT experience
* Experience with message-based systems, REST Api communication
* Knowledge of Typescript, React, Redux and CSS
* Experience working with services in Azure Portal – Functions, Web Apps, Service bus (nice to know), Storage (nice to know)
* Good knowledge in Azure DevOps – Scrum, Git, Pipelines (nice to know), Biceps (nice to know)
* Proficiency in English


**We offer**
 In the same way that we place expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome.
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment.
* Possibility of hybrid workplace.
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities.
* Great insurance benefits.


**Additional Facts About The Recruitment Process**
 Application deadline: 10th of August 2025.
   

 To apply for the position: Please attach your CV and answer a couple of questions via our application portal. No personal letter needed.
   

 Work location: Stockholm, Oslo
   

 Travelling: Some travel in the Nordic/Baltic countries will be required
   

 Start: By agreement
   

  

 For more information, please contact Henric Lindqvist Sales Chapter Lead (henric.lindqvist@if.se, +46707965009 or Artis Jāne Policy Chapter Lead (artis.jane@if.lv, +37126554294).
   

  

 Read more about our Tech Community at If and how we together create tech that matters: www.if.no/tech or www.if.se/tech.
   

  

 Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: AI Marketing Lead
description:
***AI Marketing Lead***




  





 Applications are considered on a rolling basis
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



  





*For social robots, the time is now: they are no longer 'science fiction'. All over the world – in universities, research labs, schools, hospitals, airports, shops, offices, hotels, and more – social robots are being explored and deployed today to help people lead better lives, support employees, delight customers, and add value to businesses, as well as provide new insights to researchers. Humans are entering a new era where interacting with machines in the most natural ways is becoming ‘normal.’ But it's still early days in this revolution. The rules are still being written, and the road ahead is wide open. Furhat Robotics has established itself as a global leader in telling the story of social robotics, and this is where you come in.* 




  





 We are looking for an
 **AI Marketing Lead** 
 with a passion for using cutting-edge AI tools to drive every aspect of our marketing strategy. You’ll be working autonomously, using your expertise in AI agents, automation, and optimization to lead our marketing initiatives with minimal supervision. This is a role for a highly independent self-starter—someone who thrives in an environment where they can take ownership, experiment, and constantly iterate on their work to deliver results.
 



  





 In this role, you will be the architect of our AI-powered marketing engine. You'll use AI agents to automate tasks, GEO optimization to target the right audience at the right time, and leverage LLM reasoning to analyze ICP fit and refine content across channels. Your independence will be key, as you'll work closely with the customer success, sales, and product teams to align on goals and integrate insights, but you'll be responsible for executing and optimizing marketing campaigns on your own.
 



  





 If you have an obsessive drive for pushing the limits of AI in marketing and the ability to work independently to execute and optimize campaigns, this is the role for you.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 As the
 **AI Marketing Lead** 
 , you will:
 


* Work independently to drive traffic and engagement across digital marketing channels, using AI-powered tools to generate leads, enhance conversions, and build brand growth
* Leverage AI agents to automate and personalize lead generation across platforms, scaling outreach efforts while maintaining a high level of personalization
* Use GEO optimization techniques to ensure our marketing campaigns are precisely targeted to local audiences, driving higher engagement and relevance
* Utilize Large Language Models (LLMs) for evaluating ICP fit, optimizing content, and ensuring that our messaging resonates with the right audience across all digital channels
* Experiment with and continuously optimize marketing campaigns using AI-powered tools to improve performance and maximize return on investment
* Analyze data from prospects and customers using AI insights to adapt marketing strategies and improve customer acquisition, engagement, and retention
* Manage the digital marketing budget independently across AI-driven platforms, ensuring the most efficient use of resources
* Take full ownership of campaigns and initiatives, applying AI to maximize their efficiency and impact
* Support event planning and execution, all with a data-driven, autonomous approach



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**To succeed in this role, you should have:** 



* 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, with a deep focus on AI tools for automation, optimization, and insights
* A
 *growth hacker* 
 mindset—obsessed with finding innovative ways to leverage AI tools to drive marketing performance
* Strong experience working independently and autonomously, with minimal supervision, taking full ownership of your work
* Hands-on experience with AI agents and automation tools to scale lead generation, content personalization, and campaign optimization
* Expertise in GEO optimization and the ability to target audiences based on geographic data to increase marketing relevance
* Familiarity with using LLMs for marketing analysis, including ICP evaluation, content optimization, and enhancing targeting strategies
* A data-driven approach to defining, measuring, and optimizing KPIs
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
* Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams (sales, customer success, product) while maintaining independence
* Deep knowledge of modern digital marketing technologies, including AI-powered analytics, CRM systems, A/B testing, and predictive analytics
* The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment where you have the autonomy to shape your projects and drive results
* A self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset, eager to leverage AI to solve marketing challenges and deliver measurable outcomes



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Native or bilingual proficiency in English
* Experience marketing to academic and research audiences
* Previous experience working with startups, especially in tech or AI-related fields
* Familiarity with robots, conversational systems, or cutting-edge technology



  





 By joining Furhat, you will be part of a high-performance, fast-moving team, driving one of the most exciting stories in technology today. With your expertise in AI-powered marketing and independent working style, you’ll play a key role in expanding our reach and advancing our mission to bring robots into the real world.
 



  





**Application Deadline** 




 We will hire the right person as soon as we find them
 



  





**Eligibility:** 




 Unfortunately we are only able to hire candidates with a valid work permit in Sweden.
 



  





**About the company** 




 We are an artificial intelligence and social robotics startup with the vision to make interaction with technology truly human. Founded by four PhDs in social robotics at KTH, we are an ambitious, small team of scientists, engineers and entrepreneurs backed by prominent investors. Our product is the most expressive and customizable social robot on the market, powered by a state-of-the-art multi-modal conversational platform and a developer suite used by 3rd party developers to build robot applications. We are now looking for high-achievers that share our passion, to join our ride.
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Kim Johansson
 



 kim@furhatrobotics.com

title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - AI Trainer
description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.
   

  

**What We Do**
 The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.
   

  

 Although every project is unique, you might typically:
   

  

* Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
* Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
* CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
* Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
* Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
* Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
* Example Tasks


**How To Get Started**
 Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
* You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
* Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
* You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
* Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


**Benefits**
**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**
* Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

title: Fullstack utvecklare
description:
**Om Vimla!** 




 Är du en nyfiken fullstack-utvecklare som vill jobba i en teknikdriven miljö och göra skillnad för hundratusentals aktiva användare? Vimla är mobiloperatören, som genom att vara en fristående del av Telenor, kombinerar kraften från en stor organisation med friheten och flexibiliteten i ett litet team. Vi står för att ta kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund så väl som medarbetare hos oss!
 







 Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Senior fullstack utvecklare, ta chansen och sök!
 








**Vad du kommer att göra** 




 I rollen som Senior Fullstack utvecklare på Vimla kommer du in i en scale-up miljö där du tillsammans med ditt team arbetar i syfte att utveckla och underhålla Vimlas tekniska miljö. Ni står i centrum för att bygga de tekniska förutsättningarna för en helt digital mobiloperatör. Du arbetar tillsammans med ett tight team av utvecklare med passion för teknik och bra stämning. Teamet består av såväl juniora som mer seniora kollegor, vilket medför en kultur av lärande och kunskapsdelning.
 







 Inom ramen för rollen kommer du
 


* Bygga och optimera våra API:er
* Förbättra vår CI/CD-pipeline
* Utveckla nya tjänster i vår digitala plattform
* Jobba med skalbarhet i vår molnbaserade miljö







 Hos oss får du möjlighet att utmanas, utveckla din kompetens och arbeta med fantastiska och kompetenta kollegor. Om du gillar att ha en möjlighet att påverka vad du jobbar med, en bredd i dina arbetsuppgifter och jobba i ett tight DevOps-team - det här är platsen för dig!
 







**Vi söker dig som** 









 Vi ser att du har minst tre års tidigare erfarenheter av utveckling inom Typescript, node backends samt react för frontend.
