 I rollen som PEGA-utvecklare och arkitekt kommer du att vara en central del av ett dedikerat team som arbetar med såväl nyutveckling som förvaltning. Teamet ansvarar för hela livscykeln – från behovsanalys till design, utveckling, test och uppföljning. Det ställs höga krav på både teknisk kompetens och samarbetsförmåga, och du förväntas kunna arbeta tvärfunktionellt där behov finns.
   

  

**Arbetsformen är hybrid** 
 med placering i Stockholm, där upp till 49 % distansarbete över ett år kan tillämpas efter överenskommelse.
   

  

****Avtalsperiod:****
 Start: 5 maj 2025
   

  

 Längd: 12 månader, med möjlighet till förlängning i ytterligare 6 månader
   

  

**Roller och kravprofil**
 🔹
 **Business Architect (nivå 4)**
 Du har en strategisk förmåga att analysera affärsbehov och omsätta dem i hållbara PEGA-lösningar.
   

  

****Krav:****
* Certifierad Pega Business Architect (PCBA) med uppdaterad badge – Pega Infinity 24
* Certifierad Professional Scrum Master
* TOGAF 9-certifiering
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet från PEGA-projekt
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av Pega CRM och arbete inom offentlig sektor
* Minst 4 månaders erfarenhet av Constellation


 🔹
 **Senior System Architect (nivå 4)**
 Som SSA kombinerar du teknisk skicklighet med systemöverblick. Du är van att ta ansvar för tekniska beslut och implementationer i PEGA-miljöer.
   

  

****Krav:****
* Certifierad Pega Senior System Architect (PCSSA) version 8.7 eller senare
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av utveckling inom systemdesign, konfiguration, test och implementation
* Deltagit i minst två Pega-projekt i liknande roll
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av Pega Customer Service
* Praktisk erfarenhet av DX API, App Studio, Constellation (minst 4 månader)
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Pega Deployment Manager och Diagnostics Cloud
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från arbete inom offentlig sektor
* Badge: Pega Infinity 24 (uppdaterad)


 🔹
 **Lead System Architect (nivå 5)**
 I rollen som LSA är du teknisk ledare med ansvar för arkitektur, lösningsdesign och kvalitet i leveranserna.
   

  

****Krav:****
* Certifierad Pega Lead System Architect (PCLSA) version 8.7 eller senare
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera modell- och processdrivna affärslösningar
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av hela mjukvarulivscykeln – från analys till support
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Pega Customer Service
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av DX API, App Studio och Constellation
* Praktisk kunskap om Pega Deployment Manager och Diagnostics Cloud
* Erfarenhet från arbete inom myndighetsmiljö
* Badge: Pega Infinity 24 (uppdaterad)


**Kommunikationskrav**
* Business Architect och Senior System Architect: Konsulterna ska kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska eller engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt. All dokumentation sker som standard på svenska.
* Lead System Architect: För denna roll krävs full språklig förmåga på svenska i både tal och skrift.


**Övrig information**

title: Uppdrag: Senior Fullstackutvecklare med DevOps-kompetens inom musikflöden
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och tekniskt brett kunnig fullstackutvecklare till ett tvärfunktionellt team som ansvarar för de digitala verktygen inom musikflödet i en journalistiskt driven miljö. Systemen hanterar allt från inmatning och hantering av musikfiler till rapportering gentemot externa upphovsrättsaktörer. Teamet präglas av samarbete, hög tillit och en stark vilja att leverera värde med empati för både kollegor och användare.
   

  

 I denna roll får du ta stort tekniskt ansvar och samtidigt bidra till ett utvecklingsteam där engagemang, samspel och gemensamt ansvar står i centrum. Rollen innebär att du under en period även stöttar i produktägarskapet, vilket kräver god förståelse för helheten och förmåga att driva arbetet framåt i samspel med både teknik och verksamhet.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
* Vidareutveckling och förvaltning av applikationer i moderna ramverk
* Backendutveckling i .NET och integration med SQL Server-databaser
* Implementering och hantering av containerbaserade lösningar med Docker/Kubernetes
* Samverkan med UX-designers och produktägare för att skapa värdeskapande funktionalitet
* Bidra till tekniska riktlinjer och arkitektur tillsammans med övriga teamet
* Aktivt delta i par-/mobbprogrammering och kodgranskning
* Delaktighet i det löpande förbättringsarbetet av teamets arbetsmetoder och utvecklingsflöde


**Kravprofil**
* Minst sex års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare, med fördjupning inom frontendramverk som Vue, React eller likvärdiga tekniker (gärna med TypeScript)
* Gedigen kunskap i .NET-miljö och minst sex års erfarenhet av backendutveckling
* Stark kompetens inom databasutveckling med SQL Server
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av containerbaserad utveckling och drift med Kubernetes och Docker i klustermiljö
* Erfarenhet av att fatta tekniska beslut tillsammans med utvecklingsteamet
* Van vid agilt arbete i samverkan med UX-designers, produktägare och andra utvecklare
* Flytande i svenska i både tal och skrift
* Möjlighet att arbeta på plats i Stockholm minst tre dagar i veckan


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att leda tekniskt, skapa struktur och stötta kollegor
* Van att arbeta aktivt tillsammans med andra utvecklare genom parprogrammering eller mobbprogrammering
* Erfarenhet av att sätta upp och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines, gärna i molnbaserade miljöer och med verktyg som ArgoCD
* Visar tekniskt nyfikenhet och ifrågasätter befintliga lösningar för att föreslå förbättringar
* Förmåga att se den större bilden och väga tekniska val mot affärsmål, användarupplevelse och långsiktig förvaltning
* Tillför nya perspektiv eller erfarenheter som stärker teamets dynamik


**Omfattning Och Praktisk Information**
* Startdatum: 25 augusti 2025
* Slutdatum: 3 december 2025 (med möjlighet till förlängning)
* Omfattning: Heltid
* Plats: Stockholm (med möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 40 %)
* Språk: Svenska (krav)

 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. title: Baseband Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you ready to shape the future of 5G?
   

  

 Within the L1 Software Development team in the Product Engineering Group RU Baseband Software, we are dedicated to designing and implementing Physical Layer Baseband functions for our Radio products. Our goal is to maintain Ericsson’s leadership in the market by delivering cutting-edge L1 solutions across diverse deployment scenarios, frequency bands, radio platforms and 3GPP/ORAN standards.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a L1 Software Developer to join our outstanding team in Kista. In this role, you’ll be working on our 5G/6G RAN L1 Software product, playing a key role in ensuring its performance and success.
   

  

 Join us at the forefront of wireless innovation!
   

  

**What you will do:**
 As a member of the L1 team, you’ll shape system architecture, implement key features, and ensure high-performance deployment. Your focus will be on the Physical Layer (L1) components of Baseband software—core building blocks of our leading 5G RAN solutions and future 6G technologies.
   

  

* Collaborate with engineers to design/systemize, develop, and maintain software components essential to product functionality.
* Enhance existing features and develop new ones, with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability—leveraging Ericsson’s evolving Multi-Core Architecture Platform.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Troubleshoot and resolve software issues to ensure seamless operation.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.
* Work within a dynamic, agile development environment to meet timelines and goals.


**Skills You Bring:**
* Passion and interest in design, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and a solid and proven expertise in embedded software design.
* Expertise in multi-core architectures and real-time systems.
* Domain knowledge in wireless communications, especially in signal processing, 4G/5G NR Physical Layer functions (highly desirable).
* Strong collaboration skills – thrive in international, multi-site teams; open communicator with a proactive, can-do attitude.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, agile environments; committed to delivering high-quality software on time.
* A drive for innovation – proactive mindset for continuous improvement in development practices.
* Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communications, or a related field.
* Relevant experience, 2–6 years in embedded software development, ideally in telecom or a related industry


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 770359

title: Lead Data Platform Engineer
description:
Vi söker en
 **Lead Data Platform Engineer** 
 till ett uppdrag i centrala Stockholm med start i början av maj. Här får du chansen att vara med från grunden i uppbyggnaden av en modern och decentraliserad dataplattform, inspirerad av data mesh-principer. Målet är att göra det enkelt för team att både publicera och konsumera högkvalitativa data.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett brett ansvar där du designar och utvecklar centrala delar av plattformen såsom katalogtjänster, orkestreringslösningar, lagringsstandarder och metadatahantering. Du kommer också att arbeta med integrationer till verktyg som Databricks, Flyte och DataHub.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har ett strategiskt tänk samtidigt som du trivs med att skriva kod. Du har god förståelse för plattformsutveckling och är bekväm med Python, metadata och CLI-verktyg. Erfarenhet av lakehouse-arkitektur och integrationer till Power BI eller Backstage är ett stort plus.
   

  

**Vi Tror Att Du Har**
* Minst 7 års erfarenhet som utvecklare, gärna inom dataintensiva system eller plattformar
* God kännedom om dataorkestrering, t.ex. Airflow, Flyte eller Dagster
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar – helst Azure, men GCP eller AWS fungerar också
* Van att arbeta med Databricks och dess ekosystem
* Förståelse för metadata, lineage och koncept som dataproduktägarskap
* Tidigare bidragit till utveckling av interna plattformar, verktyg eller gemensamma tjänster


**Teknisk Kompetens**
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och CLI
* Gärna erfarenhet av SQL
* Meriterande med kunskap inom Power BI, lakehouse-arkitektur och Backstage


**Personliga egenskaper:** 
 Du är pragmatisk, gillar samarbete och har lätt för att kommunicera med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.
   

  

**Uppdragets Längd**
 Start: 5 maj 2025
   

  

 Slut: 7 november 2025

title: Uppdrag: Business Intelligence-specialist med fokus på datamodellering och informationsstruktur
description:
Vi söker en kvalificerad och erfaren BI-specialist som vill ta en nyckelroll i ett datadrivet initiativ med fokus på styrning, uppföljning och beslutsstöd inom hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn. Uppdraget syftar till att strukturera, modellera och tillgängliggöra data på ett sätt som skapar värde i form av insikter och förbättrad styrning. Du kommer att ingå i ett projekt med hög strategisk betydelse där din förmåga att översätta verksamhetsbehov till effektiva datamodeller är avgörande.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med både verksamhetsrepresentanter, IT-specialister och analytiker. Du kommer att ansvara för att bygga robusta informationsstrukturer, säkerställa datakvalitet, dokumentera begreppsmodeller och arbeta med metadatahantering. Det krävs att du har god förståelse för verksamhetsprocesser och kan se samband mellan datakällor, affärslogik och analysbehov.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utforma logiska och fysiska datamodeller utifrån Kimballs metodik och stjärnschema.
* Dokumentera begreppsmodeller, informationsstrukturer och datamodellbeskrivningar.
* Validera och kvalitetssäkra data som används för analys och rapportering.
* Hantera metadata och bidra till utvecklingen av datakataloger.
* Arbeta tillsammans med BI-utvecklare för att definiera faktatabeller, dimensioner och strukturer som stödjer analys och visualisering.
* Analysera verksamhetens behov och omsätta dessa till tekniska lösningar och informationsflöden.
* Ansvara för kravanalys och dokumentation kopplad till modellering, integration och rapportstruktur.
* Versionhantera modeller i ett dynamiskt projektlandskap.


**Obligatoriska Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att bryta ner verksamhetsbehov till dimensionsmodeller enligt Kimballs Enterprise Bus Matrix-metod.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av begreppsmodellering på konceptuell och logisk nivå där flera verksamhetsprocesser integreras.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med BI-lösningar, datalager och SQL-baserad analys.
* Starkt fokus på datakvalitet, metadatahantering och strukturerad informationsmodellering.
* Erfarenhet av modellversionshantering i större projektmiljöer.
* Van att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och med kravställning från olika intressenter.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Förståelse för hälso- och sjukvårdsverksamhet, särskilt kopplat till budgetstyrning och vårddata.
* Kännedom om vårdbegrepp och erfarenhet av informationsmodellering i reglerade eller datatunga verksamhetsmiljöer.


**Övrig Information**
* Omfattning: Heltid, 100%
* Start: Mellan juni och augusti 2025 (exakt startdatum enligt överenskommelse)
* Slut: 2026-12-31
* Plats: På plats hos uppdragsgivaren – med möjlighet till visst distansarbete i överenskommelse med projektets behov och ansvarig chef.


**Dokumentationskrav För Ansökan**
* Uppdaterat CV på svenska
* Ifylld kompetensmatris (mall tillhandahålls separat)
* Genomförandeplan (max en halv A4-sida)
* Tillgänglighet och motivering till uppdraget
* Referenser från minst två uppdrag inom de senaste fem åren som visar erfarenhet av Kimball-modellering eller begreppsmodellering i komplexa verksamheter (minst 6 månaders varaktighet per uppdrag)


 Detta uppdrag passar dig som har en passion för datadriven utveckling, en djup förståelse för BI-arkitektur och som vill vara med och forma framtidens beslutsstöd i en samhällsviktig sektor. Du kombinerar teknisk spets med förmåga att se verksamhetens behov och kan navigera mellan detaljer och helhet.
   

  

**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. title: Svar ska lämnas senast:
description:
25 april
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid (100 %)
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm eller Sundsvall, med krav på närvaro på kontoret minst 1–2 dagar i veckan, eller mer beroende på verksamhetens behov.
   

  

**Period:** 
 Start 9 juni 2025 – 1 år med möjlighet till förlängning i två omgångar om 6 månader vardera.
   

  

**Uppdragets Innehåll**
 En iOS-utvecklare efterfrågas för att bidra i ett uppdrag kopplat till en europeisk digital identitetslösning. Uppdraget innebär att delta i ett team med ansvar för att ta fram en säker och tillförlitlig mobilapplikation för hantering av digitala intyg, legitimationer och liknande dokument. Det är en ny satsning där säkerhet och kvalitet står i fokus.
   

  

**Intervjutillfälle:** 
 Konsulten behöver kunna delta i intervju den 9 maj.
   

  

**Obligatoriska Krav (ska-krav)**
* Konsulten ska uppfylla nivå 3 (erfarenhet mellan 4 och 8 år).
* Ange aktuell bostadsort.
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av modern native-utveckling för iOS.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av programmering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i team enligt agila arbetssätt i minst 3 år.
* Gedigen kunskap i både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
* Goda färdigheter i git, Swift och SwiftUI.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter (bör-krav)**
* Arbetat med implementation av säkerhetslösningar såsom Secure Enclave eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av modern apputveckling på Android, t.ex. Jetpack Compose.
* Van vid att bygga och distribuera appar via TestFlight eller liknande verktyg.
* God insikt i testning, både enhetstester och UI-tester.
* Kunskap inom PKI och hantering av certifikat.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla appar som följer WCAG och tillgänglighetsprinciper.
* Har tidigare bidragit till eller utvecklat öppen källkod.


**Referensuppdrag**
 Till anbudet ska ett relevant referensuppdrag för den föreslagna konsulten bifogas. Det ska:
   

  

* Ha avslutats högst tre år före sista ansökningsdatum.
* Om det fortfarande pågår, ha varit aktivt i minst sex månader.
* Omfatta motsvarande uppgifter som beskrivs i detta uppdrag.
* Ha utförts i rollen som anställd eller konsult.
* Innehålla uppgifter om uppdragsgivare, samt namn, telefonnummer och e-post till referensperson.
* Tydligt visa att konsulten haft en aktiv roll.
* Ha omfattat minst 800 arbetade timmar.

* Information om leverantörens företag (UK, organisationsnummer och kontaktuppgifter).

title: Kafka Engineer
description:
*Bankgirot söker nu en Kafka Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.* 




*Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk.* 




  





*Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag. Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Kafka Engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att bygga och förvalta en robust eventdriven arkitektur – på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och för varandra.* 




  





**Din roll** 




 Som Kafka Engineer kommer du att vara med och etablera och vidareutveckla en robust, säker och skalbar plattform för realtidsdata och moderna integrationslösningar. Du ansvarar för att vår Kafka-miljö fungerar effektivt och pålitligt, i nära samarbete med utvecklare, plattformsteam och säkerhetsfunktioner.
 



  





 Du kommer att jobba både proaktivt och reaktivt – från design och implementation till drift, övervakning och felsökning. Rollen är tekniskt bred och passar dig som vill kombinera djup teknisk expertis med ett helhetsperspektiv på systemarkitektur, säkerhet och prestanda. Dina huvudsakliga områden:
 



  




* Design, implementation och förvaltning av Apache Kafka-kluster
* Vidareutveckling och drift av komponenter som Kafka Connect, Schema Registry och ksqlDB
* Prestandaoptimering och incidenthantering i enlighet med ITIL
* CI/CD och Infrastructure as Code (t.ex. Ansible, Terraform)



  





 Utöver detta arbetar du med accesskontroll, logghantering och säkerhetsanpassningar. Du bidrar även till teknisk dokumentation och kunskapsdelning inom teamet och deltar aktivt i förändringsprocesser kopplat till plattformens vidareutveckling.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Du är en erfaren tekniker med passion för distribuerade system, dataflöden och robust infrastruktur. Du arbetar strukturerat, har ett säkerhetsfokuserat synsätt och trivs i miljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har mycket god kunskap om Apache Kafka och plattformsarkitektur, liksom erfarenhet av Kafka-ekosystemets olika delar såsom Connect, ksqlDB och Schema Registry. Du har även god förståelse för automatisering och Infrastructure as Code, med verktyg som Ansible och Terraform, samt erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg.
 



  





 Vi ser gärna att du är van att arbeta med containerplattformar som Kubernetes eller Docker och har god insikt i säkerhet, åtkomstkontroll och loggning i distribuerade system. Du har troligtvis arbetat i verksamhetskritiska miljöer där tillgänglighet och säkerhet är centrala krav, och har en relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur i större system, kunskap om övervakningsverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana och ELK/EFK, samt erfarenhet av molnbaserade Kafka-tjänster såsom Confluent Cloud eller AWS MSK.
 



  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
 



 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44.
 



  





 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
 



  





 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
 



  





 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Graphic Designer
description:
***Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications. You need a Swedish work permit in order to be considered.***

 ***Please note - you need a portfolio of relevant art in order to qualify for this role.***

  

Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games. Our games can be played both in social gaming and real money modes. We have wide distribution and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world. We have a world-class team of developers, artists and animators who create some of the top performing games in our industry, and we are looking to grow our team with more talented graphic designers who love games as much as we do.

  

You will be part of our game development team and work in a tight knit team involving both graphic designers, artists, developers and project managers. We offer a nice office in central Stockholm, an opportunity to work with other experienced game designers as well as a co-ownership program for suitable candidates.

 **The job:**

  

We are looking for a graphic designer who can give a fresh take to our games look and brand identity (instant win games) At Hacksaw Studios you will work closely with other designers and creative people to create modern and stylish new games.

 **Your tasks will include:**

* Create concepts for new games
* Designing assets, logos and brand guidelines to set new standards
* Participate in game progress reviews and give feedback about the implementation process
* Co-operate with colleagues with similar roles, both in-house and with our partners
* Learn about the online gaming industry and stay up to date on current trends and what is popular with players

 **Required skills and experience:**

* A solid graphic design portfolio
* Understanding of colors, typography, shapes, textures, values and UI/UX
* Experience with the Adobe suite

  

To apply for this role, please submit your CV and your portfolio at https://hacksawstudios.bamboohr.com/jobs

title: Product Owner & Team Lead Embedded Systems (all genders)
description:
**Job Title:** Product Owner & Team lead - Embedded Systems (all genders)

**Location:** Munters, Kista

**Overview:**


At Munters, we are on a mission to shape a more sustainable world through innovative climate solutions. As we continue our digital transformation, we are looking for a **Product Owner & Team Lead for Embedded Systems (all genders)** to join our team in Kista.


This role position combines the responsibilities of a Product Owner—guiding embedded product development with a user-centric and platform-aligned approach—with team leadership responsibilities. You will lead a team of embedded system developers, and support the collaboration with other teams and stakeholders, and play a key role in team development, performance, and motivation.


This position offers a unique chance for someone who enjoys integrating strategic product management with direct leadership of a technical team

**Key Responsibilities:**

**As Product owner:**

* **Own and prioritize the backlog**


You will work closely with the Product Managers and Technical Product Managers to translate the product vision and roadmap into user stories and tasks, prioritize and deliver high-quality features while maintaining alignment with customer needs and technical feasibility.

* **Foster a collaborative team environment**
* Work closely with hardware and software developers, scrum master, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to build a cohesive team that thrives on open communication, trust, mutual respect, and shared goals. You should be able to handle and resolve disagreements constructively, ensuring that all team members are included and valued

* **Align with platform strategy**
* Prioritize embedded systems and platform improvements that directly impact product features or control system capabilities. Collaborate with line manager and embedded software developers to ensure platform development supports product development.

* **Product support & improvements**
* Handle and prioritize support cases escalated from the global service team — focusing on critical product issues and product improvements. Ensure timely resolution and clear communication with relevant stakeholders throughout the process.

* **Support production tools & testing**


Act as the main point of contact for the production team regarding the embedded control system, configuration tools, and end-of-line testing. Collect and assess their input and support needs, ensure clear communication on firmware releases, bug fixes, and tool updates, and prioritize their requirements in the product backlog. Collaborate closely with production to develop and improve tools and processes that support efficient and reliable manufacturing.

* **Drive timely and qualitative delivery**
* Collaborate with the Scrum Master role and the technical team to define user stories, ensure features are delivered on time, and meet expected quality standards.

* **Validate features and user needs**


Use feedback loops, testing, and analytics to evaluate feature effectiveness and guide backlog updates

**As a Team Lead:**

* **Lead and support the team**


Serves as the **day-to-day go-to person** for team members, providing coaching, support, helping resolve blockers, and regular development dialogues.

* **Foster a supportive culture**


Promote a psychologically safe and collaborative environment where team members recognize being engaged, heard, and empowered

* **Performance & competence development (in coordination with line manager)**


Gives regular feedback and guidance on performance and development needs.

* **Resource planning and recruitment (in coordination with line manager)**


Supporting with identifying resource needs, supporting recruitment and onboarding.

* **Act as a cultural role model**


Set a positive tone, promote cross-team alignment, and be a change agent during organizational transformation.

**Requirements:**

* Experience as a Product Owner or similar role in embedded systems or control systems
* Prior leadership experience or clear potential to take on formal people leadership.
* Thorough understanding of agile methodologies, Scrum
* Comprehensive understanding of embedded systems and their integration into product development
* Familiarity with **C/C++** and embedded development practices.
* Practical experience with Azure DevOps or Jira for backlog and sprint management
* Experience in embedded system development, including working with control systems and platform improvements.
* Analytical skills with a focus on technical product development and customer needs.
* Experience handling technical support cases and collaborating with technical teams to resolve issues efficiently.
* Skilled written and verbal communications skills in English
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field

**Soft skills:**

* Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate across hardware, software, and business teams
* Ability to actively listen to feedback from the team, customers, and stakeholders, and use this input to adjust the product direction when needed.
* Ability to collaborate in a diverse and cross-functional work environment to ensure alignment and that everyone is working toward the same objectives.
* Help create a productive environment that motivates team members to collaborate and share their knowledge
* Ability to make informed decisions on which features to prioritize based on business needs, user value, and technical resources is essential. This requires a balance between making quick decisions and remaining responsive to feedback and data.
* Lead the team through disagreements to align on ways of working within the team as well as with other stakeholders
* Be able to inspire the team by clearly conveying the product vision in a compelling way that encourages engagement and motivation
* Be able to make sound decisions even when not all facts are available, and act as a stable leader when the team is facing challenges.
* Skilled at balancing short-term delivery and long-term goals.
company_description: Munters is a global leader in climate control solutions for mission-critical processes.

title: Head of Service Offering
description:
**This is us**


At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.


**This is the job**


As a Head of Service Offering, you play a senior leadership role, responsible for providing strategic direction and oversight to drive success within a specific industry sector. You are responsible for establishing and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders, while driving growth and innovation within the designated industry. You lead a team dedicated to ensuring the successful delivery of business solutions, services, and projects, contributing to the overall efficiency and success in targeted industry vertical by fostering partnerships, and ensuring the alignment of organizational goals with industry-specific needs.

**This is you**


You will provide strategic direction for the respective Service Offering developing and executing initiatives that contribute to the unit’s growth and prominence within the specified industry.


You are experienced in collaborating with executive leadership to ensure alignment of industry strategies with overall business goals. You know how to conduct thorough market analyses to identify opportunities, risks, and industry trends. You also utilize market insights to inform strategic decision-making and guide the development of tailored solutions.


You find it fulfilling to cultivate and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including clients, industry partners, and regulatory bodies. You’re experienced in collaborating with cross – functional teams to ensure the delivery of solutions that meet industry-specific needs.


In this role you will collaborate with internal teams to ensure the delivery of products or services that meet industry-specific needs. You will lead and inspire a multidisciplinary team, including industry specialists, business developers, and strategists, to execute initiatives effectively. You therefore see the value in fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and high performance within the Service Offering team.


You are experienced in business development efforts by identifying and pursuing opportunities for growth within the industry. This may come in the form of establishing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the success and impact of industry-specific initiatives whilst staying up to date of industry regulations and compliance requirements.


You know how to implement data-driven decision-making to optimize performance. You are also experienced in working with senior management to define and manage budgets related to Service Offering initiatives, and how to optimize resource utilization and financial performance within the Service Offering.


We're looking for someone who finds it fulfilling to create a vibrant and motivated community where people have a sense of belonging, are encouraged to grow, and improve, share knowledge together, as well as contributing to a positive and collaborative working culture. And in this community, to support the professional career development paths of lead employees within the Service Offering


You are experienced in supporting the Sales organization in acquiring new clients and opportunities related to the Service Offering. As a key team member, you will build a reputation as an ambassador, emerging leader, and innovator for the company, but also cultivate external networks, building relationships and networks to enhance impact, brand and identify new business areas.


You demonstrate high level of professionalism in all business activities including positive and constructive attitude, co-worker interaction, client interaction and communication.

**Skills:**


* Strong business and industry/domain knowledge, to successfully handle various business situations and make well informed decisions
* Proven experience with financial management for effective optimization of resources, budget preparation and effective application of financial goals and metrics, for the respective Service Offering
* Significant experience in project management, leading and managing large - scale projects with ability to ensure maximum performance and dedication
* Results-oriented mindset, with ability to hold oneself and others accountable, for the high quality, timely and cost-effective deliveries, for the respective Service Offering
* Effective communication skills and ability to influence employees, senior managers, and stakeholders and ensure client/business alignment
* Effective leadership skills, with ability to inspire, empower and coach less experienced leaders in managing client-focused teams and initiatives
* Strong interpersonal and networking skills, leading to successful client relationships, and expanding new business opportunities for the respective unit
* Ability to anticipate / identify / adjust to change, successfully leading and supporting others through different stages of the change process
* At least 10 years of experience in a leadership role within a Cloud, DevOps and Infrastructure Services
* Fluency in English, spoken and written

**What awaits you at Avenga?**
  

Through our values, Better Minds, Bolder Ideas and Bigger Hearts, we strive to provide you with the tools, the autonomy, the trust, and assistance you need to excel. Enjoy benefits like private health insurance, well-being programs, flexible and hybrid work models, laptops and gear, trainings, language classes, social events, great offices, and more.
  

  

*We take pride in the diverse skills and character of our teams, welcoming everyone to apply and contribute to our collective strength.*
  

  

*We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which could mean that the process ends before the final application date, so don't wait to apply.*
company_description: Avenga is an international consultancy and technology solutions partner with 6000+ specialists globally.

title: UX Designer
description:
*På Länsförsäkringar älskar vi design! Hos oss finns ett designteam på cirka 40 digitala designers (UX Designers, UX Writers och UI Designers) med den uttalade ambitionen att leverera marknadens bästa kundmöte. För att nå dit söker vi fler som vill ingå i Sveriges kanske trevligaste designgäng!*  


**Så jobbar vi med design**

Länsförsäkringar är ett kundägt bolag, så kundfokus är en del av vårt DNA på riktigt. Designteamet ansvarar för att kunden alltid möts av enkla och effektiva gränssnitt som förenklar kundens vardag. Vi jobbar med design som ett strategiskt verktyg och vi är noga med detaljer. Vi är måna om att dela kunskap med varandra och att ha en feedbackkultur, tvärs roller och erfarenhet inom teamet. Därför har vi olika typer av kunskapsforum och feedbackträffar i teamet, med både UX/UI Designers och UX Writers.  


**Om rollen**



Som UX Designer skapar du flöden och lösningar för de features som teamet jobbar med. Du jobbar i ett agilt team där du tillsammans med UX Writer och UI Designer skapar fantastisk design. Du tar ansvar för UX i teamets leveranser, med övriga designteamet som nära bollplank. På Länsförsäkringar vill vi ha med design tidigt i processer, så vi ser till att vi skapar värde för både kund och affär.  



Typiska arbetsuppgifter:
* Utforska och skissa fram lösningar i linje med kundbehov och affärsmål
* Balansera att följa våra designmönster för igenkänning med att utmana dem för att höja nivån
* Planera och utföra användningstester regelbundet
* Säkerställa att designen följer riktlinjer för tillgänglighet
* Ta välgrundade designbeslut baserade på research
* Vara kundens röst i det löpande arbetet
* Bolla och feedbacka med övriga designers
* Samarbeta tätt med dina teammedlemmar i att ta fram design som levererar mot vårt mål om marknadens bästa kundmöte

  


**Vem är du?**

Du har minst 5 år erfarenhet, och utöver det ser vi följande egenskaper som särskilt viktiga:
* Du brinner för användarperspektivet, och ser användarcentrering som något självklart
* Du är van vid de verktyg som gäller för UX Designers idag (vi använder Figma)
* Du tycker att tillgänglighetsaspekten är en självklar del av UX-arbete
* Du trivs med att ge och ta feedback för att hela tiden bli utvecklas och få andra att växa
* Du tar initiativ och hittar en väg framåt i de fall när en del av designutmaningen är att tydliggöra behoven och/eller lösningsrymden
* Du vet och gillar att designarbete är ett lagarbete, både inom designteamet och i ditt agila team

  



Har du UI-kunskaper är det ett plus, men inget måste. Kunskaper inom tillgänglighet är också något vi sätter stort värde på. Har du erfarenhet av att jobba i agila team är det också meriterande.  


**Om oss**

Customer Experience är en avdelning inom Digital & IT-affärenhet på LFAB, som ansvarar för att skapa de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna i kundens olika möten med oss. Här får du kollegor som brinner för kunddriven utveckling. Du kommer att tillhöra gruppen Design.  

  

I gruppen – liksom hela organisationen - värderar vi en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid högt. Vi ser att vår flextid finns där just för att kunna anpassa jobbet till ditt liv och inte tvärtom.  

Engagemang, tillit, professionalism och öppenhet är det som driver utveckling hos oss. I vår organisation leder återkoppling och uppföljning av dina prestationer affären framåt. Samma öppenhet som vårt starka varumärke står för strävar vi även efter internt. Mångfald värderas högt i vår verksamhet och vi lägger stort fokus på hälsa för att skapa balans mellan jobb och fritid.  


**Mer information & ansökan**
*Låter det spännande?* *Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag.*  


***Vi behandlar ansökningarna löpande, men intervjuprocessen startar i mitten av augusti efter semesterperioden.***  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2025-08-15**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Leonhard Rauch
**Kontaktuppgifter:** leonhard.rauch@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.
company_description: Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
### **Join Our Team: Senior UX Designer**


Mozaiq is looking for a sharp, experienced **Senior UX Designer** to support web-based design and conversion-focused experiences across a range of marketing-driven digital projects.


This is a **freelance, hourly role**—ideal for someone who combines strategic UX thinking with strong attention to detail, and who’s comfortable working with both global teams and US-based stakeholders.

### **About the Role**


You’ll lead UX strategy and execution for client websites and landing pages—designing intuitive, responsive, and high-converting experiences that support brand and marketing goals. You’ll bring structure and clarity to complex information, while collaborating with marketers, developers, and project managers across time zones.

### **Responsibilities**

* Translate business and user requirements into wireframes, flows, and user journeys
  
* Build and iterate responsive UX frameworks for websites and landing pages
  
* Develop and refine site structures and page-level hierarchies
  
* Collaborate with designers and developers to hand off dev-ready design logic
  
* Run usability testing and refine concepts based on data and feedback
  
* Advocate for smart UX decisions that align with conversion goals and design best practices
  
* Work with existing design systems and improve modular UX documentation where needed
  

### **Requirements**

* 4+ years of experience in UX design with a portfolio that shows your thinking (not just finished screens)
  
* Expertise in Figma and interactive prototyping tools
  
* Comfortable working with design systems and UX pattern libraries
  
* Solid understanding of front-end dev needs and how to hand off clearly
  
* Strong communication and assertiveness—especially in async/remote environments
  
* Fluent in English and able to present to internal teams and clients when needed
  
* Available to overlap with US-based stakeholders between **18:00–20:30 CET**
  

### **About Mozaiq**


Mozaiq is a fully remote team with roots in the US and Eastern Europe. We build powerful, cross-functional teams that support some of the most sophisticated marketing organizations in the world.


**Global Family:** We’re diverse, collaborative, and close-knit


**Meaningful Work:** You’ll help world-class teams make smarter decisions


**Inclusive Culture:** We invest in growth, learning, and long-term relationships

  

**Contractor Benefits**

* 100% remote work
  
* Flexible hours — set your own schedule
  
* Competitive hourly pay
  
* Exposure to global clients and brands
  

**Note:** This is a fully remote role, with team members spread across multiple time zones. While we offer flexible working hours, we do ask for some availability between **18:00 and 20:30 CET** to overlap with our US-based marketing team (6–9 hours behind CET).

title: Product Manager – PV and Battery Solutions
description:
**About Aira**


10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.


With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.


Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.

 **About the Role**  

We are building a pioneering team to shape the future of residential energy. As Product Manager – PV and Battery Solutions, you will take end-to-end ownership of our power products, with a clear focus on commercial impact, customer experience, and strategic market fit. This is a highly cross-functional role that sits at the intersection of product strategy, technology innovation and business development.
  

  

Your mission will be to define and deliver a compelling offering within our integrated home energy ecosystem. You will coordinate the roadmap activities from initial concept to launch, as well as ongoing in-life management, driving growth through customer insight, strategic partnerships, and strong execution.
  

This is a senior role that requires both strategic thinking and operational excellence. You’ll work closely with hardware and software engineering, UX, marketing, and local market teams—while also engaging external technology partners and vendors to ensure we deliver a differentiated and scalable offering to our customers.

  

  

**What you’ll be doing**  

* Define and lead the vision, strategy, and high-level roadmap for our power product portfolio, with a strong emphasis on commercial opportunity and competitive positioning
* Orchestrate the end-to-end product lifecycle: from market analysis and concept validation to product development, launch, and optimization
* Translate customer, market, and regulatory insights into product requirements that balance commercial goals with technical feasibility
* Develop product requirements and specifications and work closely with hardware and software engineering, design, and program management teams to ensure product requirements are met
* Partner with go-to-market teams to develop value proposition and ensure successful product launches, positioning, and channel readiness across markets
* Serve as the internal advocate and evangelist for our power product offering, ensuring alignment, enthusiasm, and clear communication across teams to drive product success
* Lead in-life product management by tracking performance, gathering customer feedback, and driving continuous improvements
* Collaborate with external partners and suppliers to strengthen our product portfolio and drive innovation and speed
* Own business case development and work closely with relevant stakeholders on pricing, and profitability models, ensuring commercial success of the solar & battery product line
* Act as a senior stakeholder in the broader energy product portfolio strategy, aligning roadmaps and opportunities across product lines

  

  

  

**What we’d like you to have**  

* 5+ years of experience in product management or product leadership roles for consumer hardware solutions
* Proven success bringing complex products to a global or pan european market
* Strong commercial acumen and experience making data-driven decisions to drive business outcomes
* Experience working with combined hardware and customer centric software development
* Track record of collaborating with both internal stakeholders and external technology or manufacturing partners
* Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills
* Experience working cross-functionally in fast-paced, high-growth environments
* Demonstrated ability to balance long-term strategic thinking with hands-on delivery
* Familiarity with grid-tied energy systems and residential solar installations
* Experience working at a fast-growing scale-ups

  

  

**What’s in it for you?**  

At Aira, you’ll gain hands-on experience in a supportive and inclusive culture where career growth is encouraged and celebrated. You’ll collaborate with diverse, international teams and help launch products that make a real difference globally.
  

Working in our entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment, you’ll have the opportunity to grow both personally and professionally—developing your skills while contributing to something meaningful. You’ll thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture where challenges are seen as opportunities and your ideas can shape the future.
  

Your work will have a visible impact—not only on the success of our products and markets, but also on the journey toward a more sustainable world.
  

  

At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.
  

  

As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual.
  

We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
company_description: We are Aira. A Scandinavian company on a mission to disrupt residential heating by empowering people to join the clean energy revolution, one home at a time.

title: Junior Product Designer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: UX Designer within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 Cambio is seeking a creative and analytical individual accustomed to taking responsibility and driving everything from user research, needs analysis to a user-centred design process. In your role as a UX Designer, you will be part of a team of dedicated and qualified colleagues who specialize in the product development of our different e-health products and services within Cambio's R&D organisation.
   

  

 Together, you work to provide healthcare professionals and other users with the best possible experience for all aspects of the care process. Your main responsibilities will include all parts of the UX design process - from conducting and analysing user research, user needs and workflows to developing new concepts or reworking existing designs, visualizing ideas, creating prototypes, and conducting usability testing and other methods to test your hypothesis and designs.
   

  

**We offer**
* The chance to be part of Cambio’s exciting journey ahead and to play a key role in shaping the future of the e-health market with great user experiences.
* A learning culture that supports your professional development and growth.
* A supportive and open team where collaboration, teamwork and knowledge sharing are part of everyday work.
* Fun activities with both the UX team but also with the whole company such as Cambio's yearly conference and other activities to build team spirit, work on our skills and to have fun together.


**About You**
 We are looking for someone with a burning passion for user experience that wants to create solutions that are based on user needs and behaviours. We also believe that you excel at involving both colleagues, end-users, and customers in your work in an engaging manner, through activities such as workshops. You need to be a social team player who generously shares your knowledge, ensuring continuous improvement in both your and your team's ways of working. As an individual, you are analytical, humble, kind and enjoy taking responsibility.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Educational background in UX design, Interaction design, Human-computer interaction, requirements analysis, graphic design, or equivalent.
* At least 3-5 years of work experience in UX design for software development and knowledge of various UX methods and tools.
* Knowledge on how to work with user-centred design and good understanding of requirements and design processes and their different phases.
* Strong knowledge in interface design and an eye for detail.
* Strong knowledge within user research.
* Able to communicate fluently in Swedish and English as required in daily communication.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Experience working with design systems.
* Experience in designing healthcare-related applications.


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm or Linköping
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 As it is currently vacation season, we will begin the selection process and start scheduling interviews in
 **week 34** 
 . We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.
   

  

 We’ll be in touch as soon as we have an update regarding your application.
   

  

 Wishing you a great summer!
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible** 
**-** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: UX Designer
description:
*På Länsförsäkringar älskar vi design! Hos oss finns ett designteam på cirka 40 digitala designers (UX Designers, UX Writers och UI Designers) med den uttalade ambitionen att leverera marknadens bästa kundmöte. För att nå dit söker vi fler som vill ingå i Sveriges kanske trevligaste designgäng!*
**Så jobbar vi med design**
 Länsförsäkringar är ett kundägt bolag, så kundfokus är en del av vårt DNA på riktigt. Designteamet ansvarar för att kunden alltid möts av enkla och effektiva gränssnitt som förenklar kundens vardag. Vi jobbar med design som ett strategiskt verktyg och vi är noga med detaljer. Vi är måna om att dela kunskap med varandra och att ha en feedbackkultur, tvärs roller och erfarenhet inom teamet. Därför har vi olika typer av kunskapsforum och feedbackträffar i teamet, med både UX/UI Designers och UX Writers.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som UX Designer skapar du flöden och lösningar för de features som teamet jobbar med. Du jobbar i ett agilt team där du tillsammans med UX Writer och UI Designer skapar fantastisk design. Du tar ansvar för UX i teamets leveranser, med övriga designteamet som nära bollplank. På Länsförsäkringar vill vi ha med design tidigt i processer, så vi ser till att vi skapar värde för både kund och affär.
   

  

 Typiska arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utforska och skissa fram lösningar i linje med kundbehov och affärsmål
* Balansera att följa våra designmönster för igenkänning med att utmana dem för att höja nivån
* Planera och utföra användningstester regelbundet
* Säkerställa att designen följer riktlinjer för tillgänglighet
* Ta välgrundade designbeslut baserade på research
* Vara kundens röst i det löpande arbetet
* Bolla och feedbacka med övriga designers
* Samarbeta tätt med dina teammedlemmar i att ta fram design som levererar mot vårt mål om marknadens bästa kundmöte


**Vem är du?**
 Du har minst 5 år erfarenhet, och utöver det ser vi följande egenskaper som särskilt viktiga:
   

  

* Du brinner för användarperspektivet, och ser användarcentrering som något självklart
* Du är van vid de verktyg som gäller för UX Designers idag (vi använder Figma)
* Du tycker att tillgänglighetsaspekten är en självklar del av UX-arbete
* Du trivs med att ge och ta feedback för att hela tiden bli utvecklas och få andra att växa
* Du tar initiativ och hittar en väg framåt i de fall när en del av designutmaningen är att tydliggöra behoven och/eller lösningsrymden
* Du vet och gillar att designarbete är ett lagarbete, både inom designteamet och i ditt agila team


 Har du UI-kunskaper är det ett plus, men inget måste. Kunskaper inom tillgänglighet är också något vi sätter stort värde på. Har du erfarenhet av att jobba i agila team är det också meriterande.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Customer Experience är en avdelning inom Digital & IT-affärenhet på LFAB, som ansvarar för att skapa de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna i kundens olika möten med oss. Här får du kollegor som brinner för kunddriven utveckling. Du kommer att tillhöra gruppen Design.
   

  

 I gruppen – liksom hela organisationen - värderar vi en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid högt. Vi ser att vår flextid finns där just för att kunna anpassa jobbet till ditt liv och inte tvärtom.
   

  

 Engagemang, tillit, professionalism och öppenhet är det som driver utveckling hos oss. I vår organisation leder återkoppling och uppföljning av dina prestationer affären framåt. Samma öppenhet som vårt starka varumärke står för strävar vi även efter internt. Mångfald värderas högt i vår verksamhet och vi lägger stort fokus på hälsa för att skapa balans mellan jobb och fritid.
   

  

**Mer information & ansökan**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag.*
***Vi behandlar ansökningarna löpande, men intervjuprocessen startar i mitten av augusti efter semesterperioden.***
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-15**

title: Product Designer – Web and Brand Experience
description:
**Are you passionate about crafting exceptional web experiences that drive growth and build iconic brands? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us shape our digital front door!**
 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034We are now looking for a talented Product Designer to join our team in Stockholm, focusing on our public webpage and lead generation efforts.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to take ownership of the user experience on our most visible platform, ensuring it not only converts visitors into leads but also consistently elevates our brand perception in line with our highly ambitious goals.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design and iterate: Take the lead in designing intuitive, engaging, and high-converting user interfaces for Aira's public website. This includes everything from initial concepting and wireframing to high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes.
* Drive lead generation: Collaborate closely with sales, marketing and product teams to understand lead generation goals and design user journeys that effectively capture and qualify leads.
* Champion user experience: Ensure a world-class, seamless user experience across all aspects of our public web presence, advocating for user-centered design principles at every step.
* Elevate brand perception: Continuously work to enhance and align the website's visual design and user experience with Aira's brand guidelines, ensuring a consistent and premium brand representation.
* Collaborate: Work in a cross-functional team with a product manager, engineers, content specialists, copywriters, and data scientists to define problems, explore solutions, and deliver impactful designs.
* User research & testing: Plan and conduct usability testing and A/B testing to gather insights and data that inform design decisions and drive continuous improvement.
* Stay current: Keep up-to-date with the latest design trends, web technologies, and best practices in UX/UI and lead generation.


**What You’ll Bring To The Role**
* Proven experience as a product designer, UX/UI designer, or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work on web design, user experience, and ideally, lead generation projects.
* A deep understanding of user-centered design methodologies, usability principles, and web accessibility standards (WCAG).
* Proficiency in modern design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma) and an openness to explore new tools that could help us be even more efficient.
* Experience with data-driven design and A/B testing methodologies.
* Experience in translating brand guidelines into compelling digital experiences and an eye for visual aesthetics.
* A proactive and iterative mindset, comfortable with turning complex problems into simple and elegant solutions.
* You thrive in a collaborative environment and are comfortable working in-office with our team in Stockholm 4 days a week.
* Fluency in English is required.


**Nice to have:**
* Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and their implications for design.
* Experience with conversion optimization for high-consideration purchases.
* Experience working in an agile development environment.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions clearly.


****Please note:****
****As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.****
****Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!****
**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Marketing & Design Intern – Real Work, Real Output
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Devoteam G Cloud is one of Google Cloud’s top partners in Europe. We work with cloud, AI, and security to help companies move faster and smarter.
   

  

 In the Nordics, our marketing team works closely with sales, partners, and leadership. We’re small, hands-on, and focused. And when we bring interns in, we involve them in actual work — not side projects.
   

  

 Interns here have gone on to full-time roles. We’re looking to do that again.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
  

 We’re hiring a
 **Marketing & Design Intern** 
 for Fall
 **2025 (Sep–Nov)** 
 in our Stockholm office.
   

  

 This role is for someone who’s good with visual content and wants to learn how B2B marketing works in a fast-moving tech company.
   

  

 You’ll work on:
   

* Visual assets for campaigns, sales enablement, and social channels
* Short video editing for LinkedIn, internal comms, and events
* Event materials (slides, banners, invites, etc.)
* Landing page visuals and simple web content updates
* Supporting live and digital campaigns across the Nordic region


 You’ll be involved in real meetings, get regular feedback, and be expected to contribute from week one.
   

  

  

**Qualifications**
  

 We’re looking for someone who:
   

* Is studying (or just finished) design, marketing, communications, or something related
* Has experience with Figma, Canva, Adobe, CapCut, or similar tools
* Has a basic understanding of digital campaigns, especially in B2B
* Can share some kind of portfolio or example work
* Is reliable, proactive, and communicates clearly
* Works well in English (Swedish, Norwegian, or Danish is a plus)


 This internship is design- and execution-focused — not strategy or planning.
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
* This is an
 **unpaid internship**
* Based in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 (Klara Norra Kyrkogata)
* Internship runs from
 **February to May 2025** 
 (flexible start/end dates)
* You’ll be on-site 2–3 days per week, with flexibility


**What you’ll gain:**
* Real-world experience in content, design, and campaign execution
* Exposure to one of Google’s top partners in Europe
* A chance to build a strong reference and professional portfolio
* A potential path to a full-time role (if the fit is right)


**How to Apply**
 Send us:
   

* Your
 **CV**
* A few
 **examples of your work** 
 (portfolio, link, folder — doesn’t need to be fancy)
* A short note on:
	+ Why this internship makes sense for you
	+ What kind of work you want to focus on


 That’s it.

title: Product Design Contractor
description:
We are seeking a talented
 **Product Design Contractor** 
 to join our Desktop team. This team is responsible for the full UX design of our Desktop application and Web player, both of which serve millions of users each month. As a designer in this team, you will work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, and other Designers to create innovative, user-centered design solutions. Your primary focus will be in the
 **Growth** 
 space, working alongside a senior designer leading the initiative. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute fresh perspectives, propose creative solutions, and drive fast-paced experimentation in a dynamic and evolving environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* UI/UX Design: Design and communicate user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups for desktop and web experiences.
* User-Centered Design: Conduct low-stakes usability testing to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement, gather user feedback, and iterate designs based on insights gathered.
* Storytelling: Present and explain design explorations, clearly communicating design decisions and their implications to stakeholders.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams (Product Managers, Engineers, User Researchers) to implement designs, ensuring consistency and high quality throughout the design and development process.
* Documentation: Maintain clear and up-to-date design documentation to ensure that development teams can easily implement designs.


**Qualifications**
* Experience: Proven experience in product design, with a strong focus on UX/UI design for web and desktop platforms.
* Skills: Proficiency in tools such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD, along with an understanding of prototyping and usability testing.
* User-Centered Approach: Strong ability to conduct user research, usability testing, and apply insights into iterative design work.
* Collaboration: Experience working in collaborative environments with cross-functional teams to deliver seamless user experiences.


**Work Environment**
* Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid work model, with occasional remote work possible)
* Duration: May 5, 2025 – November 4, 2025
* Collaborators: Weekly design team events, regular cross-functional rituals, with collaboration across teams in Stockholm and the UK.


 This role offers the chance to contribute across all stages of product development, from ideation and prototyping to testing, QA, and delivery, while helping the team maintain focus on high-priority initiatives and ensuring exceptional design quality. Join us to drive impactful user experiences and shape the future of the product.
   

  

**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Experience Designer, UX, Kyndryl Vital, Nordics & Baltics
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Role
   

  

 At Kyndryl Vital, UX Designers craft intuitive and user-centered digital experiences that solve real human problems through thoughtful interface design, interaction patterns, and information architecture. This role focuses on creating products that are not only visually appealing but also usable, accessible, and valuable to end-users. Through user research, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing, UX Designers ensure that digital solutions meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

 As a specialist and leader in UX design, you will:
   

  

* Lead UX initiatives across various projects, ensuring interfaces are intuitive, accessible, and aligned with client objectives
* Conduct user research to identify pain points, behaviors, and opportunities for design innovation
* Create user personas, journey maps, and information architecture that inform design decisions
* Develop wireframes, prototypes, and interaction patterns that effectively communicate design concepts
* Facilitate design workshops and user testing sessions to validate design solutions
* Build and maintain strong client relationships, serving as a trusted UX advisor throughout the project lifecycle
* Guide design teams in creating cohesive user experiences across multiple touchpoints and platforms
* Collaborate with developers and product managers to balance user needs with technical feasibility
* Advocate for user-centered design principles throughout the organization
* Own the UX process from discovery and ideation to testing and implementation


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   

  

* User-Centered Design: You have a deep understanding of UX methodologies, including user personas, journey mapping, and information architecture.
* Interaction Design: You can create intuitive user flows, navigation patterns, and micro-interactions that enhance usability across digital products.
* Usability Testing: You excel at designing and facilitating usability tests to validate design decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Wireframing & Prototyping: You can create low to high-fidelity prototypes using industry tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD to communicate design concepts effectively.
