title: KAFKA ENGINEER TILL BANKGIROT
description:
Bankgirot söker nu en Kafka Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk.
  
Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag. Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Kafka Engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att bygga och förvalta en robust eventdriven arkitektur – på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och för varandra.
  
Din rollSom Kafka Engineer kommer du att vara med och etablera och vidareutveckla en robust, säker och skalbar plattform för realtidsdata och moderna integrationslösningar. Du ansvarar för att vår Kafka-miljö fungerar effektivt och pålitligt, i nära samarbete med utvecklare, plattformsteam och säkerhetsfunktioner.
  
Du kommer att jobba både proaktivt och reaktivt – från design och implementation till drift, övervakning och felsökning. Rollen är tekniskt bred och passar dig som vill kombinera djup teknisk expertis med ett helhetsperspektiv på systemarkitektur, säkerhet och prestanda. Dina huvudsakliga områden:
  
Design, implementation och förvaltning av Apache Kafka-kluster
  
Vidareutveckling och drift av komponenter som Kafka Connect, Schema Registry och ksqlDB
  
Prestandaoptimering och incidenthantering i enlighet med ITIL
  
CI/CD och Infrastructure as Code (t.ex. Ansible, Terraform)
  
  

Utöver detta arbetar du med accesskontroll, logghantering och säkerhetsanpassningar. Du bidrar även till teknisk dokumentation och kunskapsdelning inom teamet och deltar aktivt i förändringsprocesser kopplat till plattformens vidareutveckling.
  
Vi söker dig som harDu är en erfaren tekniker med passion för distribuerade system, dataflöden och robust infrastruktur. Du arbetar strukturerat, har ett säkerhetsfokuserat synsätt och trivs i miljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har mycket god kunskap om Apache Kafka och plattformsarkitektur, liksom erfarenhet av Kafka-ekosystemets olika delar såsom Connect, ksqlDB och Schema Registry. Du har även god förståelse för automatisering och Infrastructure as Code, med verktyg som Ansible och Terraform, samt erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg. Vi ser gärna att du är van att arbeta med containerplattformar som Kubernetes eller Docker och har god insikt i säkerhet, åtkomstkontroll och loggning i distribuerade system. Du har troligtvis arbetat i verksamhetskritiska miljöer där tillgänglighet och säkerhet är centrala krav, och har en relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet.
  
Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur i större system, kunskap om övervakningsverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana och ELK/EFK, samt erfarenhet av molnbaserade Kafka-tjänster såsom Confluent Cloud eller AWS MSK.
  
  

Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmånerSom vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter. Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
  
  

Övrig informationTjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
  
Intresserad?I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44. Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
Om BankgirotBankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
  
Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
  
Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Senior Solutions Architect, AWS Telco Business Unit
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a technical leader to help global telecommunications service providers transform their businesses with AWS cloud and generative AI technologies. AWS Solutions Architects work on the most complex customer challenges and opportunities, leading in defining technical strategies and developing our own capabilities.
  

  

The problem domains are diverse: 5G monetization, network function virtualization, digital customer journeys, OSS/BSS transformation, mobile edge computing, hyperscale data and cybersecurity. At your disposal is the breadth of AWS, including GenAI, classical AI/ML, edge computing, IoT, and data analytics.  

  

As part of the Telecommunications Solutions Architecture team, you will collaborate with customers, internal AWS teams, and AWS partners to deliver solutions to the unique challenges faced by telecom customers. You will be the single-threaded owner of the AWS technology strategy for your customer(s) and account team(s) to drive AWS adoption. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value while assessing risks, balancing trade-offs, and encouraging risk-tasking to maximize your customer's business value of AWS is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think long-term about business, product, and technical outcomes.  

Our team is small and motivated. We come from diverse backgrounds, but what we all have in common is a huge curiosity, a passion for delighting our customers, and a desire to deliver technology that transforms their business.  

  

What’s it like to work at AWS? Our team experiences high levels of collaboration, lots of multi-tasking, and often course corrections or new ideas that mean adaptability is key. We find creative and scalable solutions to our customers’ difficult problems, and we own delivering those outcomes to the customer. We are also a geographically-distributed team, which means you will need to possess a high bias for taking action without immediate team consensus.  

  

Solutions Architects work on the most complex customer challenges and opportunities. They have a leading role in developing both the strategy and the team itself. They combine an informed view of the market with their understanding of emerging technology trends to speed-up innovation across their customer segment. Externally, they are recognized thought leaders and influence the strategy of our customers. Internally, they earn a reputation of role models and deliver bar-raising guidance to the broader Solutions Architecture team.  

  

  

Key job responsibilities  

In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to invent cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
  

You will take a leading role in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology and industry trends (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).  

If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.  

This role is within the EMEA Telco organization and you would be working with large Telco customers.  

  

Role requires domestic and international (mainly Europe) travel up to 30%.  

  

  

About the team  

The AWS Industries team is committed to helping industry customers enable their digital transformation journeys. Our primary goal is to meet customers in their cloud journeys and work backwards from their industry-specific needs to transform their businesses and industries. Our team focuses on business outcomes and industry use cases on behalf of our customers, whether that is how we build products and solutions, how we sell, how we deliver, or how we partner.  

  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent
* Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries
* Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
* Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
* Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience in infrastructure architecture, databases, and networking across regulated industries
* Experience working with developer communities and understanding their needs
* Deep knowledge of AWS services, solutions architecture, and operational excellence
* Understanding of market segments, customer bases, and industry verticals
* Proficiency with software development methodologies and tooling

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
  
Job details


SWE, Stockholm


Solutions Architect

title: Rekryteringsadministratör
description:
**Rekryteringsadministratör**
=============================


Sista ansökningsdatum: 5 augusti

Svenska kraftnät spelar en nyckelroll i resan mot ett än mer elektrifierat Sverige. Den fortsatta elektrifieringen kommer vara avgörande för att nå ett hållbart samhälle, med konkurrenskraft och stark välfärd. Vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag är en förutsättning för att elen som produceras ska nå ut till människor.
  

Vill du vara med och jobba för ett lysande Sverige?



På Gemensamma funktioner stöttar vi hela organisationen och arbetar varje dag för att förverkliga Svenska kraftnäts gemensamma mål. Vår division samlar expertis inom kommunikation, HR, juridik, inköp, säkerhet och beredskap, fastighet samt hållbarhet – allt för att skapa en stabil och hållbar framtid för Sveriges energiförsörjning.  

Enhet Rekrytera och attrahera för tillsättningar av nya tjänster på verket. Vi söker dig som har jobbat några år med rekrytering- och utbildningsadministration samt har god vana av system. Som rekryteringsadministratör har du ett viktigt jobb inom rekrytering.


**Om tjänsten**
---------------



Som rekryteringsadministratör är ditt huvudansvar att i nära samarbete med rekryterarna i teamet arbeta i rekryteringsprocesser och tillsammans med kollegorna på enheten fortsätta att utveckla befintlig rekryteringsprocess och dess olika moment samt ansvarar för utbildningsadministration och systemförändringar i vårt utbildningssystem.Dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar bland annat administrativt stöd inom rekrytering, personaladministration och anställningsavtalshantering, det sistnämnda innebär att du ansvarar för den avslutande rekryteringsadministrationen såsom anställningsavtal, uppdateringar i vårt administrativa system, kontakter med vår personalsäkerhetsenhet. Du supportrar handläggare av utbildningar runtom i verksamheten genom administration av utbildningsupplägg, kontouppsättningar med mera.  

Tjänsten är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Sundbyberg.



Du kommer att tillhöra Enhet Rekrytera & attrahera som idag består av 18 medarbetare fördelat på rekryterare, rekryteringsadministratörer och employer branding specialister. Enhetens uppdrag innebär att vara chefsstöd vid rekrytering, att stödja chefer löpande under hela rekryteringsprocessen samt säkerställa en kvalitativ introduktion av nya medarbetare och konsulter.  

Enheten ansvarar för Svenska kraftnäts strategiska och operativa arbete inom employer branding, bland annat aktiviteter gällande studentrelationer, studentmässor och andra evenemang för att attrahera nya medarbetare till Svenska kraftnät.


**Om dig**
----------


**Skallkrav:**



Personliga egenskaper:



För att lyckas i rollen behöver du arbeta på ett strukturerat sätt, vilket innebär att du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt och är van att sätta upp och hålla tidsramar. Du hittar snabbt lösningar på uppkomna problem och månar om att arbeta effektivt och lösningsfokuserat. Då rollen innebär många kontaktytor, både internt och externt, är du som person bra att på att skapa förtroende, kommunicerar tydligt och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Sist men inte minst är du lyhörd för andras synpunkter och framför dina förslag på ett förtroendeingivande sätt.  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.



Utbildning:  

  

Vidare har du en avslutad högskoleutbildning inom personalvetenskap eller beteendevetenskap eller avslutad gymnasieutbildning och därefter minst 3 års arbete med rekryteringsadministration.



Vidare har du:


* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av rekryteringsadministration och god vana av rekryteringssystem.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med system- och utbildningsadministration.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom statlig verksamhet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Svenska och Engelska i såväl tal som skrift.


**Meriterande:**


* Erfarenhet från utbildningssystemet SABA Cloud.
* Rekryteringssystemet ReachMee.
* Administration inom övriga HR områden, (utöver rekrytering och utbildningsadministration).

**Bra att veta**
----------------


* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm/Sundbyberg, #LI-DNI
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %.
* Resor kan förekomma i denna tjänst.
* Sista ansökningsdag är 5 augusti 2025, vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en Tillsvidareanställning, utan provanställning.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryterande personer:



Rekryterande chef, Sara Bäckström.  

Ansvariga rekryterare, AnnSophie Brezén eller Lennart Jansson.
  

Fackliga representanter:  

Annika Ingeborn, SACO tel. 010 475 87 72.  

Erica Midfjäll, ST, tel. 010 475 87 31.
  

Du når oss också via e-post: förnamn.efternamn@svk.se



Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät



Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Senior Penetration tester
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*


Your role


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Penetration Tester to join our growing security team. In this role, you will be a key contributor in safeguarding our digital assets and protecting sensitive information by proactively identifying vulnerabilities and recommending robust security solutions.


The role includes different responsibilities such as:


Lead Penetration Testing Engagements: Plan, design, and execute comprehensive penetration tests across a variety of systems and applications, including web applications, networks, mobile platforms, and cloud environments.


Employ Advanced Techniques: Utilize a wide range of penetration testing methodologies, tools, and techniques, staying abreast of the latest vulnerabilities and attack vectors.


Detailed Vulnerability Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of identified vulnerabilities, assessing their potential impact and providing clear and concise documentation of findings.


Develop Actionable Recommendations: Provide practical and effective remediation strategies and security recommendations to address identified vulnerabilities, working closely with IT and development teams to implement solutions.


Threat Modeling and Risk Assessment: Contribute to threat modeling exercises and risk assessments, proactively identifying potential attack scenarios and recommending appropriate security controls.


Technical Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior penetration testers, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and professional development within the team.


Stay Ahead of the Curve: Continuously research and evaluate emerging security threats, vulnerabilities, and attack techniques to ensure the team's testing methodologies remain cutting-edge.


Your profile


To succeed in this role we believe you have 5+ years of hands-on experience in penetration testing, with a demonstrated track record of success in identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities. You have a deep understanding of network protocols, operating systems, web technologies, and common vulnerabilities.


Expertise in using industry-standard penetration testing and scripting languages. Industry-recognized certifications such as OSCP, CEH, GPEN, or similar are desirable. You should also have a excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.


If you have experience in specific industry verticals (e.g., aerospace, defense, finance) or experience with cloud security assessments – that’s preferable.


This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.


What you will be a part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Senior Solutions Architect, AWS Telco Business Unit
description:
- Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent
- Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries
- Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
- Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
- Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients
  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a technical leader to help global telecommunications service providers transform their businesses with AWS cloud and generative AI technologies. AWS Solutions Architects work on the most complex customer challenges and opportunities, leading in defining technical strategies and developing our own capabilities.
The problem domains are diverse: 5G monetization, network function virtualization, digital customer journeys, OSS/BSS transformation, mobile edge computing, hyperscale data and cybersecurity. At your disposal is the breadth of AWS, including GenAI, classical AI/ML, edge computing, IoT, and data analytics.
As part of the Telecommunications Solutions Architecture team, you will collaborate with customers, internal AWS teams, and AWS partners to deliver solutions to the unique challenges faced by telecom customers. You will be the single-threaded owner of the AWS technology strategy for your customer(s) and account team(s) to drive AWS adoption. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value while assessing risks, balancing trade-offs, and encouraging risk-tasking to maximize your customer's business value of AWS is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think long-term about business, product, and technical outcomes.
Our team is small and motivated. We come from diverse backgrounds, but what we all have in common is a huge curiosity, a passion for delighting our customers, and a desire to deliver technology that transforms their business.
What’s it like to work at AWS? Our team experiences high levels of collaboration, lots of multi-tasking, and often course corrections or new ideas that mean adaptability is key. We find creative and scalable solutions to our customers’ difficult problems, and we own delivering those outcomes to the customer. We are also a geographically-distributed team, which means you will need to possess a high bias for taking action without immediate team consensus.
Solutions Architects work on the most complex customer challenges and opportunities. They have a leading role in developing both the strategy and the team itself. They combine an informed view of the market with their understanding of emerging technology trends to speed-up innovation across their customer segment. Externally, they are recognized thought leaders and influence the strategy of our customers. Internally, they earn a reputation of role models and deliver bar-raising guidance to the broader Solutions Architecture team.
Key job responsibilities
 In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to invent cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. 
 You will take a leading role in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology and industry trends (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.
 This role is within the EMEA Telco organization and you would be working with large Telco customers.
Role requires domestic and international (mainly Europe) travel up to 30%.
About the team
The AWS Industries team is committed to helping industry customers enable their digital transformation journeys. Our primary goal is to meet customers in their cloud journeys and work backwards from their industry-specific needs to transform their businesses and industries. Our team focuses on business outcomes and industry use cases on behalf of our customers, whether that is how we build products and solutions, how we sell, how we deliver, or how we partner.
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
  

* Experience in infrastructure architecture, databases, and networking across regulated industries
* Experience working with developer communities and understanding their needs
* Deep knowledge of AWS services, solutions architecture, and operational excellence
* Understanding of market segments, customer bases, and industry verticals
* Proficiency with software development methodologies and tooling

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Sales Manager (New Business) - Nordics
company_industry: Software Development and Human Resources Services
description:
**JOB PURPOSE:** 




  





 With full scope to sell across ADP's Payroll and HR solutions, this role also provides the infrastructure, presence and brand for sales leaders to orchestrate true, global conversations with organisations. You will work as part of the leadership team and with your sales team to define individual territory plans, focusing on new prospects in the Nordics. You inherit an established, but growing sales team. The types of deals that you get to work on will vary; it could be a 3-5 month process with 3/4 stakeholders, at €50-100,000 in year 1 revenue for a local only offering. Equally, it could be a longer, more complex, multi solution or country solution at several times the value.
 



  





  





 With a world class induction programme, a leadership team offering best-in-breed expertise built from within ADP and the wider industry, and over 75 years of heritage and capability, the role offers the perfect platform for sales leaders and people, to succeed and develop.
 



  





  





**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at
 **ADP Awards and Recognition.** 




  





  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITES / TASKS:** 




  




* Responsible for the overall management, performance and development of the Nordics sales team in line with agreed sales strategy and overall business plan.
* Responsible for development and maintenance of comprehensive plan for team sales activity including pipeline and productivity. Will also manage both quota and non-commercial objectives for all individuals/team.
* Responsible for the management of all active sales processes within the team, ensuring co-ordination of company resource in an optimal and effective manner in support of these processes.
* To liaise closely with the VP Sales, other sales leaders and the operations / enablement team in pursuance of a consistent approach to sales/product/commercial strategy.
* Will submit the relevant management reports in a timely manner including up to date forecasting information.



  





**EXPERIENCE NEEDED:** 



* Experience managing a remote field-based sales team
* Experience leading new business teams with a target focus of selling to Mid Market/Enterprise level customers
* Evidence of coaching sales team to perform using a structured sales process and methodologies
* SaaS / HCM / Tech solution sales experience of 5+ years
* Examples of coaching top sales performers to achieve target, and achieve deals in the region of €100k + ARR
* Based in / close to Stockholm with full right to work and driving licence



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Highly competitive salary and compensation plan
* An on-going, individualised, world class induction programme - offering both local and international training and development
* Realistic targets + valuable offerings = real earnings. We like to see our associates overachieving, and celebrate this regularly with early starts, quarterly and annual awards, clubs and trips. Recent ones include a 5-star stay in Buenos Aires and a luxury cruise around Greece!
* Excellent support teams to help you get there!
* A sales team and presence in Stockholm and the Nordics – you are not alone!
* Flexible benefits program



  





 If this sounds like you and what you're looking for, or if you'd like to learn more, then please do get in touch!
 



  





 Sales Manager, Sales Leader, New Business Sales, Sales Management, Software as a Service, SaaS, Human Resources, HR, Human Capital Management, HCM, Cloud Software

title: Lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow
description:
**Att jobba som lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow**
 Som lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow hos Skandia blir du en del av vårt ServiceNow & Configuration team i Stockholm bestående av utvecklare, arkitekt och processpecialister.
   

  

 Teamets övergripande mål är att säkra ett driftstabilt Skandia. Du får möjlighet att påverka såväl plattformens strategiska inriktning som de dagliga tekniska lösningarna. I din roll leder du utveckling och förvaltning av ServiceNow, samverkar nära verksamheten, designar lösningar utifrån verksamhetskrav och säkerställer att dessa implementeras enligt best practice. Vardagen är varierad från att sätta den långsiktiga arkitekturella roadmappen till att ibland bistå vid felsökning och arbete hands-on i plattformen.
   

  

 Du får arbeta tvärfunktionellt med Skandias olika affärsområden från IT och säkerhet till HR, juridik och inköp, vilket ger både bredd och möjlighet till verkligt inflytande över plattformens framtid.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT process & leveransstöd.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi tror att du har gedigen erfarenhet av ServiceNow och tidigare har arbetat som lösningsarkitekt. Du har jobbat med ITSM, CMDB, Discovery samt dagligen designat och underhållit API-integrationer. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, i tal såväl som skrift. Meriterande är om du har kunskap om ITIL och SAFe.
   

  

 Som person är du målmedveten, engagerad och noggrann. Din styrka ligger i att analysera behov, förklara komplexa lösningar och driva arbetet framåt tillsammans med andra på olika nivåer.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Monica Eriksson på monica.eriksson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

*Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Data Infrastructure team at Visa Global Open Banking provides the infrastructure, tools, and pipelines needed to support our organization’s data-driven applications. Our mission is to ensure that data is collected, transformed, and presented in a secure, timely, reliable, and cost-efficient manner.
   

  





 Key Responsibilities:
   

  




* Design, build, and maintain large-scale, cloud-based data services.
* Develop and maintain automated CI/CD pipelines and processes.
* Monitor and ensure the reliability and performance of the data infrastructure.
* Implement and enforce best practices for data security and compliance.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to support production systems.



 If you are a talented and passionate Data Infrastructure Engineer looking for a new challenge, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team in central Stockholm!
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* 3+ years of engineering experience.
* Proven success in designing, building, and managing large-scale, cloud-based services.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Hands-on experience in an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) environment (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation).
* Proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Go, or Python.
* Experience with data warehouse tools (e.g., dbt, Apache Airflow).
* Strong understanding and experience with Cloud Security best practices.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**Visa’s Technology Organization** 
 is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  

  

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  





  

  





**The Opportunity:** 
  

  





 As a Sr. Engineering Manager, you will lead a world-class team of Engineers to define, drive and execute on a shared strategic vision for providing OpenBanking solutions in global markets. You will collaborate very closely with product and tech partners and leading 1-3 engineering teams to contribute to our mission of delivering innovative and high-quality services to our customers.
   

  

  

  




* Full accountability for the overall delivery, performance and quality of the products in your area
* Responsible for the overall development life cycle of the solution
* Work with product partners in developing road maps to provide compelling capabilities that helps them succeed in their business goals
* Work closely with architects and senior engineers to develop the best technical design and approach for new product development
* Instill best practices for software development, and deliver high quality work on tight schedules
* Identify opportunities for further enhancements and refinements to standards and processes
* Mentor & motivate junior team members.
* Resolve team conflicts and keep team focused on the VISION.
* Being data-driven and always seeking new ways of improving your services
* 



**What we offer you**




 Tink and Visa offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the chance to lead and shape the future of our engineering teams and be part of a mission to deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers.
   

  

  

  

 Reporting to Engineering Director, this role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in our organization and drive the success of our engineering teams. If you are a motivated and experienced leader, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

  

  

 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  





  

  





 Qualifications: We're looking for a talented and driven Senior Engineering Manager who can lead and inspire teams. The ideal candidate is proactive and willing to get involved hands-on whenever necessary. We believe this person has extensive experience in management and leading cross-functional teams. We expect you to be able to set priorities and provide direction, build relationships with stakeholders, and support the growth and development of their team.
   

  





  

  

 We like you to have:
   

  




* Experience in management roles, leading senior engineers or other managers, or being in a similar role where “leading at scale” was required
* A strong technical background with a degree in engineering or similar. Before moving into leadership, you have several years’ experience as a backend engineer
* Experience building a scalable, high-volume platform and collaboratively setting the architectural direction with senior engineers
* Experience with setting high expectations for your teams, and having coached, grown, and mentored them to reach their goals
* Solid experience working in an agile development environment
* Experience building a business-oriented area and a learning organization
* Experience from working with customer-facing products where operational excellence and high uptime is a requirement
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills
* Fluency in English



**The Skills You Bring** 
 :
   

  




* **Energy and Experience** 
 : A growth mindset that is curious and passionate about technologies and enjoys challenging projects on a global scale
* **Challenge the Status Quo** 
 : Comfort in pushing the boundaries, ‘hacking’ beyond traditional solutions
* **Builder** 
 : Experience building and deploying modern services and web applications with quality and scalability
* **Learner** 
 : Constant drive to learn new technologies such as Angular, React, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.
* **Partnership** 
 : Experience collaborating with Product, Test, Dev-ops, and Agile/Scrum teams



  

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

 8+ years of relevant work experience and a Bachelors degree, OR 11+ years of relevant work experience
   

  

 We're looking for a talented and driven Senior Engineering Manager who can lead and inspire teams.
   

  





 The ideal candidate is proactive and willing to get involved hands-on whenever necessary. We believe this person has extensive experience in management and leading cross-functional teams. We expect you to be able to set priorities and provide direction, build relationships with stakeholders, and support the growth and development of their team.
   

  

  

  

  

  

 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

 9 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or 7 or more relevant years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 3 or more years of experience with a PhD
   

  

  

  

 Experience in management roles, leading senior engineers or other managers, or being in a similar role where “leading at scale” was required
   

  

 A strong technical background with a degree in engineering or similar. Before moving into leadership, you have several years’ experience as a backend engineer
   

  

 Experience building a scalable, high-volume platform and collaboratively setting the architectural direction with senior engineers
   

  

 Experience with setting high expectations for your teams, and having coached, grown, and mentored them to reach their goals
   

  

 Solid experience working in an agile development environment
   

  

 Experience building a business-oriented area and a learning organization
   

  

 Experience from working with customer-facing products where operational excellence and high uptime is a requirement
   

  

 Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills
   

  

 Fluency in English
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Role: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Workload: Full-time (100%)**
**Remote Work: Up to 40%**
**Duration: 12 May 2025 – 30 November 2025**
**Location: Stockholm Metropolitan Area, Sweden**
**Role Overview**
 We’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer to take on a senior-level role where you'll independently build and refine advanced data pipelines across diverse business areas. The role includes hands-on development, technical mentoring, and driving data solutions from concept to execution.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Design and maintain complex data workflows to support efficient data exchange across systems and departments.
* Use advanced SQL to retrieve, transform, and analyze large datasets to support various business functions.
* Develop with Python or Java, applying object-oriented principles and unit testing to ensure code quality.
* Provide technical guidance to less experienced engineers and promote best practices across the team.
* Translate business needs into technical solutions, presenting data insights to stakeholders for strategic alignment.
* Identify and implement system enhancements, ensuring cost-effective and reliable data infrastructure.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to advance data capabilities and contribute to the overall data vision.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in a technical or related field
* Between 3 and 6 years of hands-on experience in data engineering roles
* Strong proficiency in SQL and one or more programming languages such as Python or Java
* Solid background in data modeling, data warehousing, and building scalable pipelines
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and development lifecycle best practices
* Ability to understand and address business challenges through data solutions
* In-depth knowledge of cloud platforms, tools, and their cost-effective application
* Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented, collaborative approach
* Independent mindset with confidence in making decisions and driving initiatives
* Experience working with visualization tools to support data-driven decisions
* Fluency in English (spoken and written)
* A valid cloud certification is required for this role


**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Data Scientist - Electricity Multi-Market Optimization
description:
Primrock is seeking an innovative and market-oriented Data scientist for the ongoing development of our services and multi-market optimization methods for capacity and energy in the Nordic electricity markets.
 



  





**About the role** 




  





 Primrock creates value through evidence-based, manual or automated, decision-making. We collect, analyze and use - real or simulated - data in everything from pricing to production. The Data scientist will contribute to our competitiveness and promote our commercial growth based on unique, novel and systematic use of our proprietary, structured and unstructured, data.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Develop pricing optimization models.
* Implement machine learning models and time series analysis for price forecasting.
* Analyze large datasets to identify market opportunities and structural changes.
* Work with cross-functional teams to deploy pricing models in daily operations.
* Stay updated on industry trends, competitive pricing strategies, and market dynamics.



  





**Tasks** 




  





 Tasks for the Data scientist include: (1) Implement our Data Strategy for value-creation based on proprietary data, (2) Develop and implement methods to measure and to collect data from our markets, physical assets and other sources, (3) Contribute to our data management, including measures to maintain secrecy, (4) Analyze, improve and re-innovate our data-driven methods – i.e. algorithms – for pricing and production optimization and, finally, (5) Propose, test and introduce new concepts and methods for value-creation based on data in our pricing, service offering or our production processes.
 



  





**Your profile** 




  





 Education: You have a Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Data Science, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics or Statistics with excellent academic results from a top school.
 



  





 Language: Professional proficiency in Swedish and English. CEFR Level C2 in both languages.
 



  





 Skill set: Proficiency in Python for data analysis and modeling and Stata, R or equivalent software for econometric analysis. Experience with machine learning frameworks. Strong knowledge of panel data, time series analysis and causal inference. Familiarity with tools for data transfer and data manipulation. Familiarity with big data tools and cloud platforms is a plus. Knowledge of dynamic pricing algorithms and optimization techniques.
 



  





 Analytical mindset: Strong understanding of market dynamics, price elasticity, and demand forecasting. Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business strategies. Capability to present findings and influence decision-making.
 



  





**About Primrock** 




  





 Primrock provides capacity and balance services to the Nordic electricity market. We are a fast-growing company on the edge of the evolving power system in Sweden. Primrock designs, builds, owns and operates physical assets (mainly large scale battery energy storage systems) to provide multiple critical services to the electricity market and Nordic synchronous power system. We offer system operators and end-users flexible, reliable, and cost-efficient power as-a-service. We strive to facilitate the transition to a 100% renewable power system by providing distributed solutions as a complement to intermittent generation from solar panels and wind turbines.
 



  





**About the job** 




  





 The position is full time (100%) at our office in Stockholm (close to Stockholm University). Primrock offers a competitive compensation package. The position will start in September 2025.
 



  





**Application** 




  





 Application deadline for this job is 31 July 2025 at 18:00 pm (CET). We look forward to your application.

title: Application Architect
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of Telia operations and be at the heart of digital IT transformation?
   

  

 I’m
 **Irmantas Petrauskas** 
 , a leading Service Order Management and Activation team focused on building next-generation service orchestration across Telia footprint.
   

  

 Right now, we’re looking for a passionate and visionary
 **Application Architect** 
 to join our journey, with a focus on Service Order Management (SOM). This role is a key in designing systems that power seamless service delivery across mobile, fixed, and converged networks.
   

  

 Whether you're based in the Nordics or Baltics, if you have a deep understanding of telecommunication services, OSS applications and a passion for architecture, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Join us and help define the architecture that drives tomorrow’s digital telco!
   

  

**As a Application Architect, you’ll...**
 You’ll be part of a distributed and international team, working in an agile environment at the forefront of Telia transformation. Our mission is to modernize and streamline service fulfillment and orchestration across mobile, fixed, and converged networks—leveraging technologies like catalog-driven orchestration, cloud-native platforms, and automation.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with other cross-functional BBS and OSS teams, as well as with leading vendors such as Ericsson.
   

  

 Your primary responsibility will be to serve as the
 **Application Architect** 
 across development initiatives and capabilities. You’ll ensure architectural consistency and technical excellence across the Service Order Management (SOM) landscape.
   

  

 This role includes, but is not limited to:
   

  

* Defining and maintaining a application and services architecture for Service Order Management.
* Leading design across projects, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture and TM Forum standards.
* Performing requirements analysis during features, and producing high- and low-level design documentation.
* Applying security-by-design principles and ensuring compliance with architectural governance.
* Acting as a technical liaison between internal teams and external vendors, ensuring quality and performance across the Service Order Management (SOM ) ecosystem.


**Who We're Looking For**
 We’re on a task to redefine how telecom services are delivered—faster, smarter, and more customer-centric. To succeed in this journey, we’re looking for someone who thrives in change, embraces complexity, and is passionate about building the next generation of OSS architecture.
   

  

 You are a forward-thinking problem solver who understands that behind every service order, there’s a customer experience that matters. You’re curious, analytical, and collaborative—someone who sees the big picture but also dives deep into technical detail. Whether you’re already an expert or aspiring to become one, you’re driven by a desire to shape how services are orchestrated, fulfilled, and managed across modern telecom networks.
   

  

 We’re open to both senior and junior profiles—what matters most is your passion for transformation and your willingness to grow into a technical leader in this space.
   

  

 Key Areas of Expertise We Value:
   

  

* Core OSS Domains: SOM (EOC, ECM), Inventory, Service orchestration, SIM/eSIM lifecycle management, TM Forum Open APIs, and catalog-driven orchestration.
* Architecture & Development: HLD/LLD documentation, system requirement analysis, roadmap planning, security-by-design, and integration.
* Platforms & Automation: Microservices, REST APIs, Kubernetes, CI/CD, cloud-native OSS, and automation frameworks.
* Ways of Working & Vendor Collaboration: Agile/SAFe methodologies, and experience working with vendors.


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 18,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

*(For Lithuanian applicants only: Monthly salary range for this position in Lithuania: 4290 – 6435 EUR before tax deduction.)*
**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 07/27/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email.
   

  

 Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to me via email or Linkedin Irmantas.petrauskas@telia.lt and kadri.remmelgas@telia.ee
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Engineering & Science - Software Engineering
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are leaders in precision radiation therapy, we're committed to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about humanity and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!


Elekta is recruiting two **Software Verification Engineers** to the R&D team Engineer to expand the R&D team in our Neuro Business Line and we have opportunities for both new or recent graduates as well as experienced engineers. In this position you’ll be part of the team responsible for developing Leksell GammaPlan®. This position is located at Elekta’s new head office at the heart of Hagastaden in Stockholm, Sweden.

**Your team**


The **Software Verification Engineer** is a member of a scrum team responsible for development of the Leksell GammaPlan® product, which is a treatment planning software fully integrated with the Leksell Gamma Knife®. The Leksell Gamma Knife® is a non-invasive, precision stereotactic treatment device used to deliver focused radiation to intercranial targets.

**What you’ll do at Elekta**


As a **Software Verification Engineer** your primary responsibility will be verification and continuous test of our products. You will be a member of a cross functional agile scrum team that specifies, develops, and tests the software used for planning of radiation therapy and radiosurgery in a development organization that works according to the SAFe agile methodology.


In this role you will be involved in all the phases of the development process including specifying requirements, test planning, test automation, test execution, defect reporting and writing formal verification reports. We have a focus on test automation using Python and the development and enhancement of our test automation framework.


Medical technology is a highly regulated and process driven industry and therefore a quality mindset is important in all that we do.


Your responsibilities include:

* Automating test cases both for test and verification
* Maintaining and updating our test automation framework
* Designing test cases
* Writing and reviewing test plans and test reports
* Executing manual test cases and performing exploratory testing
* Participating in risk reviews
* Contributing to continuous improvements
* Participate in the cross functional agile scrum teams

**The right stuff**


To be a suitable candidate for this position we think you are a problem solver who is passionate about helping people through the development of medical technologies. Python programming skills are important, and a good knowledge of Linux is a merit. We think you are a driven and proactive team player with good communication skills who wants to work in an agile development environment.


You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science, medical technologies or related studies. Our business language is English so good written and spoken communication in English is important.

**Sound Interesting?**

Apply now by clicking the “Apply” link. Please note that we do not accept applications via e-mail. We will read applications continuously so please send us your application today! Last day to apply is 2025-08-15. **Submit your CV and cover letter in English.**


Our treatment solutions can be used to treat everyone and anyone, no matter who they are. Hence, we encourage applicants that are as diverse as the patients treated with our solutions.

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope. Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and LinkedIn.*

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description** **Visa’s Technology Organization** is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.  

  

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

  



**The Opportunity:**


As a Sr. Engineering Manager, you will lead a world-class team of Engineers to define, drive and execute on a shared strategic vision for providing OpenBanking solutions in global markets. You will collaborate very closely with product and tech partners and leading 1-3 engineering teams to contribute to our mission of delivering innovative and high-quality services to our customers.  



* Full accountability for the overall delivery, performance and quality of the products in your area
* Responsible for the overall development life cycle of the solution
* Work with product partners in developing road maps to provide compelling capabilities that helps them succeed in their business goals
* Work closely with architects and senior engineers to develop the best technical design and approach for new product development
* Instill best practices for software development, and deliver high quality work on tight schedules
* Identify opportunities for further enhancements and refinements to standards and processes
* Mentor & motivate junior team members.
* Resolve team conflicts and keep team focused on the VISION.
* Being data-driven and always seeking new ways of improving your services

 **What we offer you**


Tink and Visa offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the chance to lead and shape the future of our engineering teams and be part of a mission to deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers.  

  

Reporting to Engineering Director, this role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in our organization and drive the success of our engineering teams. If you are a motivated and experienced leader, we would love to hear from you.  

  

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

  

Qualifications: We're looking for a talented and driven Senior Engineering Manager who can lead and inspire teams. The ideal candidate is proactive and willing to get involved hands-on whenever necessary. We believe this person has extensive experience in management and leading cross-functional teams. We expect you to be able to set priorities and provide direction, build relationships with stakeholders, and support the growth and development of their team.

  

We like you to have:

* Experience in management roles, leading senior engineers or other managers, or being in a similar role where “leading at scale” was required
* A strong technical background with a degree in engineering or similar. Before moving into leadership, you have several years’ experience as a backend engineer
* Experience building a scalable, high-volume platform and collaboratively setting the architectural direction with senior engineers
* Experience with setting high expectations for your teams, and having coached, grown, and mentored them to reach their goals
* Solid experience working in an agile development environment
* Experience building a business-oriented area and a learning organization
* Experience from working with customer-facing products where operational excellence and high uptime is a requirement
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills
* Fluency in English

**The Skills You Bring**:

* **Energy and Experience**: A growth mindset that is curious and passionate about technologies and enjoys challenging projects on a global scale
* **Challenge the Status Quo**: Comfort in pushing the boundaries, ‘hacking’ beyond traditional solutions
* **Builder**: Experience building and deploying modern services and web applications with quality and scalability
* **Learner**: Constant drive to learn new technologies such as Angular, React, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.
* **Partnership**: Experience collaborating with Product, Test, Dev-ops, and Agile/Scrum teams

  

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**  

Basic Qualifications:  

8+ years of relevant work experience and a Bachelors degree, OR 11+ years of relevant work experience  

We're looking for a talented and driven Senior Engineering Manager who can lead and inspire teams.


The ideal candidate is proactive and willing to get involved hands-on whenever necessary. We believe this person has extensive experience in management and leading cross-functional teams. We expect you to be able to set priorities and provide direction, build relationships with stakeholders, and support the growth and development of their team.  

  

  

Preferred Qualifications:  

9 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or 7 or more relevant years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 3 or more years of experience with a PhD  

  

Experience in management roles, leading senior engineers or other managers, or being in a similar role where “leading at scale” was required  

A strong technical background with a degree in engineering or similar. Before moving into leadership, you have several years’ experience as a backend engineer  

Experience building a scalable, high-volume platform and collaboratively setting the architectural direction with senior engineers  

Experience with setting high expectations for your teams, and having coached, grown, and mentored them to reach their goals  

Solid experience working in an agile development environment  

Experience building a business-oriented area and a learning organization  

Experience from working with customer-facing products where operational excellence and high uptime is a requirement  

Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills  

Fluency in English

 **Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: TS Field Engineer
description:
