At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
  
Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
  
Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
  
Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.
  
The Field Engineer is responsible for the service activity on products supplied by Baxter/Hillrom in Nordics and base of operations is in Rosersberg - Stockholm. They will need to undertake their duties in compliance with assigned company procedures (e.g. Control of Service Documentation, Environmental Health & Safety).
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Install, service, repair and maintain products, distributed by Baxter/Hillrom in the defined area of responsibility as per the defined service documentation and the quality system framework.
  
Establish & maintain timely customer communications & relationships, along with other key partners (e.g. team members and business units).
  
Report all relevant service activity, ensuring updated and accurate service data in the service system (all work orders should be closed within the same day).
  
Responsible for maintaining and documenting the assigned calibration equipment.
  
Provide technical support for in-bound calls from customer & patients, document the job on the system and undertake the relevant actions.
  
Maintain up-to-date technical competence in assigned products by effectively completing the relevant training and development.
  
Find opportunities for new business or business growth for products & services and raise to the relevant partners (e.g. account managers, Inside Sales).
  
Review KPIs regularly and adapt the working practices to ensure service level is maximised.
  
Plan and perform qualified technical training to distributors, partners, and colleagues.
  
Coordinate and disseminate technical updates and bulletins.
  
Be the technical guide and support for customers, account managers and engineers. This includes being the technical issue point for the designated product group.
  
Raise and communicate updates to the monthly SME calls.
  
Represent UKIN interests in EMEA/Global technical community.
  
Provide technical feedback into contracts & tender submissions.
  
  

**Job Requirements:**  

Practical experience within medical industry.
  
Degree, HNC/HND or equivalent level qualification in the relevant engineering field is preferable, but not essential.
  
Good IT knowledge on general connectivity, network integration of devices, wireless protocols, mobile network technologies, software support and cyber security standards would be advantageous.
  
Frequent and regular travel within the assigned geographical region in Sweden/Nordics.
  
Driving license.
  
Fluid in Swedish and English language.

title: Simulation Engineer
description:
**We Are:**


At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.


Our HAPS platform is the industry-leading FPGA-based prototyping solution, delivering state-of-the-art hardware and advanced software for best-in-class integrated prototyping. The Synopsys Lund team is at the forefront of new product development and support for HAPS hardware, providing unique opportunities to participate in every stage of the design process—from specification to validation.

 **You Are:**


You are a passionate and detail-oriented simulation engineer, eager to make a significant impact in the realm of hardware prototyping and thermal analysis. With a strong foundation in thermal engineering, you thrive on solving complex challenges and are motivated by the opportunity to innovate in a collaborative, high-tech environment. You have at least five years of relevant experience and a deep understanding of thermal phenomena in electronic systems, especially as they relate to PCB layouts and FPGA-based hardware.


You are comfortable navigating the entire product lifecycle, from pre-design predictions to hands-on validation in the lab. Your curiosity drives you to continuously learn and apply new methods, staying ahead of the latest advancements in electronics thermal analysis. You are recognized for your analytical thinking and adept problem-solving, and you value clear, effective communication with colleagues across disciplines.

 **What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Conduct pre-design thermal simulations for PCB layouts to optimize hardware performance and reliability.
* Perform system-level thermal analysis to identify and mitigate potential hotspots and ensure efficient cooling strategies.
* Utilize flow analysis tools to evaluate and enhance airflow management in complex hardware systems.
* Design and execute post-design verification protocols, including thermal measurements and data analysis.
* Develop and implement thermal test procedures in climate chambers to validate simulation results and hardware robustness.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams—hardware, firmware, and manufacturing—to drive design improvements and ensure seamless integration.
* Document simulation methodologies, results, and recommendations for internal knowledge sharing and process optimization.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and contribute to continuous process improvement within the R&D team.

 **The Impact You Will Have:**

* Enable the delivery of robust, high-performance FPGA-based prototyping platforms by ensuring optimal thermal design and management.
* Reduce development cycle times by providing precise thermal predictions and early design insights.
* Enhance product reliability and customer satisfaction by validating hardware under a wide range of thermal scenarios.
* Contribute to the continuous innovation of HAPS, maintaining Synopsys’ leadership in the prototyping space.
* Support the development of next-generation electronic systems that power critical applications worldwide.
* Promote knowledge sharing and best practices within the team, elevating the collective expertise of the R&D group.

 **What You’ll Need:**

* Master’s degree in thermal analysis, mechanical engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in electronics thermal analysis and simulation.
* Proficiency in at least three of the following: PCB layout thermal prediction, system thermal analysis, flow analysis, verification of results, thermal measurements, and thermal test design in climate chambers.
* Strong problem-solving and debugging skills, with a proven record of tackling complex technical challenges.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
* Experience with hardware design involving FPGAs or the application of FPGAs in other domains (preferred).
* Programming or scripting expertise to support simulation and automation tasks (preferred).

 **Who You Are:**

* Collaborative and supportive, valuing teamwork and shared success.
* Curious and eager to learn, always seeking new knowledge in electronics and thermal engineering.
* Adaptable, able to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced R&D environment.
* Proactive and self-driven, with a strong sense of ownership over your work.
* Kind, respectful, and committed to fostering an inclusive and positive workplace.

 **The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:**

You’ll join the Synopsys Lund R&D team, a group of dedicated engineers focused on developing and supporting the HAPS hardware platform. Our team values innovation, open communication, and continuous learning. We work closely together across disciplines to deliver advanced prototyping solutions that power the next generation of semiconductor products.

 **Rewards and Benefits:**

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings
company_description: Synopsys is a valued partner for silicon to systems design across a wide range of vertical markets, empowering technology innovators with the industry’s most comprehensive and trusted solutions.

title: Field Service Engineer II
description:
Overview:
* Are you looking for an impactful role for a fast-growing company that helps advance science and human well-being?
* Would you like the freedom of being field based where no day is the same and you get the opportunity to become a trusted advisor to our customers?
* Are you looking for lots of opportunities to grow, develop, learn, and progress in your career?
* Do you want to work for a global best-in-class, innovative technology organization who are highly focussed and committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion?


If your answers are yes, then we would love to hear from you!  

At Waters, we design and manufacture innovative products, solutions, and services to help our customers solve their scientific challenges. The people who work for us make a real difference in solving problems that matter, they are passionate and proud of their work and accomplishments, making Waters a great place to work.  

As a **Field Customer Support Specialist,** you will support customers across a wide variety of lab-based scientific business sectors meaning your role is very diverse and interesting, no two days are the same!  

With Waters being a Global Organization, there are endless opportunities for you to learn, grow and develop. Many of our team members have advanced their careers either in their current roles or moving into different parts of our business such as applications support, sales, global support, and leadership.
Responsibilities:
**So, what do our Field Customer Support Specialists do? Below are some of the key responsibilities:*** Install, qualify, validate, calibrate, maintain, and repair Waters systems.
* Analyse and review system and scientific data to determine the source of problems and recommend repair, replacement, or other corrective actions.
* Coordinate problem resolution with our matrix teams to help expedite repairs and deliver customer satisfaction.
* Manage customer expectations by communicating work performed and providing follow-up plans if required.
* Build strong rapport and trusted advisor partnerships with our customer base to provide them with suitable advice and support on Waters products and services – always looking for potential opportunities as to how Waters can further advance their laboratory operations.


To help achieve the above, you will get the best possible training, be supported by a fantastic team, and embark on a continuous learning and development pathway.
Qualifications:
**Who are we looking for?*** We ask that you are interested in science, problem-solving, service, and people!
* You could have a laboratory, analytical, chemistry, or engineering background.
* It’s important that you are flexible and enjoy variety in your role as well as being able to build trusted relationships with our customers.


Waters recognizes that there is an under-representation of people from diverse backgrounds within STEM careers and we recognize some groups face marginalization through the job application process. As an inclusive employer, we welcome applications from everyone; you don’t need to meet all the requirements of the role – if you feel you can add value to our business, we want to hear from you. **Rewards**
In return, we offer a highly competitive, market-leading benefits package for our employees:  

* Flexibility - We offer a lot of flexibility within your day both with your time and tasks.
* Great Opportunities for growth, development, and progression
* Competitive salary and incentive
* Company Car
* Wellbeing Programs and Services, Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
* Private Health Care
* Strong pension contribution
* Employee Insurance (Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Disability Protection, Global Business Travel Accident Insurance)
* Paid Annual Leave (5 weeks) plus statutory days
* Maternity & Paternity Leave
* Education/Tuition Reimbursement where applicable
* Social events on the calendar
* Great working environment surrounded by great people


Company Description:

Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) is a global leader in analytical instruments, separations technologies, and software, serving the life, materials, food, and environmental sciences for over 65 years. Our Company helps ensure the efficacy of medicines, the safety of food and the purity of water, and the quality and sustainability of products used every day. In over 100 countries, our 7,600+ passionate employees collaborate with customers in laboratories, manufacturing sites, and hospitals to accelerate the benefits of pioneering science. *Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It benefits our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.*
company_description: Waters is unlocking the potential of science by solving problems that matter. Are you ready to unlock your next opportunity with us?

title: Project Manager - Delivery Projects
description:
PrimeComp is a technology consulting firm with assignments in energy, industry, and infrastructure. Through our combined experience and unique range of technical expertise, we offer services to create profitable, innovative, and sustainable solutions.

  

At PrimeComp, we take pride in delivering excellence across our consulting services. We are now seeking a Senior Project Manager to lead and execute medium to large, moderately complex customer projects within the HVDC Control & Protection area. The role is pivotal in ensuring project delivery that meets customer expectations, financial targets, and high standards for quality, safety, and compliance.

 **Responibilities:**

* Lead and oversee project execution, ensuring compliance with contractual obligations and financial targets.
* Drive customer satisfaction and target fulfillment, while negotiating with suppliers and customer representatives to handle deviations and claims.
* Establish project execution strategies and monitor hand-over, execution planning, and control activities for both internal and external resources.
* Successfully manage the delivery of assigned projects on-time, within budget, and adhering to all quality and safety frameworks.
* Serve as a software Lead Engineer for the HVDC Control & Protection area, coordinating engineering teams to implement Control & Protection requirements using the MACH platform.
* Contribute to the basic Conceptual Design team, delivering fundamental building blocks for Control & Protection applications and acting as an expert throughout project execution.

 **Qualifications & Skills:**

* Certified Senior Project Manager (PMP or IPMA Level B/C).
* Minimum six (6) years of project management experience, preferably in complex projects.
* Extensive knowledge of HVDC control and protection systems and the MACH platform.
* Power system/control & protection expertise, with several years of domain experience.
* Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or a technical degree with 10–15 years of relevant experience.
* Fluent communication in English and Swedish (mandatory).
* Strong ability to lead teams, manage complexity, and implement solutions for challenged projects.

title: Calibration Engineer
description:
**Requirements Summary:**

* Strong experience with combustion engines is essential.
* Background with Volvo or similar industry experience is highly valuable
* Proven experience working with EAT (Engine Aftertreatment) systems—you should have a solid understanding of how these systems operate and interact with the engine. Full system-level experience is required.
* Software knowledge is a strong advantage, especially in relation to engine calibration.
* The role involves Primarily on-site work as testing is done on site


The position also includes responsibilities related to data post-processing and analysis.

**Project Details:**

* Run engine test cells to optimise and validate engine and aftertreatment system (EATS) performance, ensuring legal compliance and feature fulfilment.
* Calibrate embedded software functions for engines and EATS based on defined prerequisites.
* Perform and support engine performance development and calibration activities in ongoing projects.
* Contribute to the selection of hardware component specifications (e.g., fuel injection equipment, turbochargers).
* Follow and contribute to verification and validation plans for engines and EATS.
* Support product maintenance by proposing and implementing technical solutions.
* Drive method and tool improvements within the engine performance team.


Actively share knowledge and provide mentorship to new team members.

**Additional Information:**  

On-site presence in Eskilstuna (Stockholm) is expected  

Immediate availability is a strong advantage

title: Battlefield Positive Play: Operations Engineer/Game Integrity Analyst
description:
### **General Information**

**Locations**: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
  

Role ID
209516
Worker Type
Regular Employee
Studio/Department
EA Studios - DICE Stockholm
Work Model
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
* **Contract**: Permanent.
* **Location**: Stockholm (relocation support can be provided).
* **Work Model**: Hybrid (3 days a week onsite weekly).


The Battlefield Positive Play team is dedicated to protecting our titles by mitigating the impact of bad actors. We collaborate with partner teams to create new services and initiatives that ensure our players enjoy a fair and positive gaming experience. Join us in keeping Battlefield fair and equitable, now and into the future.


Are you passionate about creating a safe and fair gaming environment for all players? Do you have the skills to analyze player behaviors and detect bad actors in online games? Do you believe that every player deserves a fun and fair gaming experience? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!


As an Operations Engineer on the Battlefield Positive Play team, you will monitor, investigate, and report on player behaviors that violate the game's Terms of Service and Code of Conduct. You will use various tools to identify and track cheaters, hackers, and other disruptive players, collaborating with the Positive Play lead and other EA teams to take appropriate actions.


You will conduct investigations into toxic behaviors, suspected cheating, and related exploits to confirm or refute reports, improving the quality of our detections. You will also evaluate data from various tools, gather and review threat intelligence, and support our anti-cheat and user-generated content (UGX) protection pipelines.

**Responsibilities**

* Monitor and analyze player behaviors and activities.
* Perform triage and investigations of enforcement appeals.
* Develop processes and systems to act on verified bad actors.
* Apply enforcements according to our Terms of Service using current processes and systems.
* Gather threat intelligence to support anti-cheat and UGX efforts.
* Document and escalate confirmed bad actor cases to appropriate teams.
* Communicate task progress and blockers to the team.
* Coordinate with other EA teams for consistent positive play enforcement.
* Provide feedback to improve the game's security, anti-cheat, and moderation solutions.

**Requirements**

* 2+ years of experience in security analysis, fraud detection, or online gaming enforcement.
* 1+ years of experience as a SOC Tier 1 analyst working with SIEM technologies.
* Excellent verbal and written proficiency in APAC regional languages, with Mandarin being essential; other language proficiencies are a plus.
* Excellent verbal and written English skills.
* Familiarity with online gaming platforms and technologies (EA Play, Steam, Xbox Live, PSN, etc.).
* Knowledge of common cheating, hacking, exploiting, and griefing methods and countermeasures.
* Basic knowledge of operating system fundamentals (processes, threads, virtual memory, etc.).
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting using tools like PowerBI, Excel, Tableau, etc.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
* Passion for gaming and positive play.
* Ability to articulate complex technical topics to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* An ability to identify knowledge gaps and seek the right sources to close those gaps.
* Ability to safely handle potentially malicious software.
* Quick learner of new technical skills.

  

  

  

***About Electronic Arts***
We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.  

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.  

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
company_addresses: 209 Redwood Shores Parkway Redwood City, CA 94065
company_description: At Electronic Arts, we exist to inspire the world to play.

title: Lead Developer
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?** 




 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people.
 



  





 We are looking for a forward-thinking and innovative person to join one of our dynamic development teams. Telenor is rapidly adapting to the digital future, and we are looking for people with a natural proactive drive who want to make a difference.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 As a Lead Developer, you will help shape the technical vision and ensure the quality of software within your team, working primarily with AWS and Java SpringBoot microservices. You will lead the design of robust, scalable, and secure solutions, while mentoring team members in best practices for coding, design, and performance optimization.
 



  





 You will collaborate with stakeholders, architects, and team leaders to support project and development planning. Your role will also involve at least 50% hands-on coding, conducting code reviews, and continuously improving development processes, focusing on maintaining the product’s technical health. You'll also be accountable for enhancing developer experience and helping the team balance short- and long-term goals, ensuring delivery of key objectives and adhering to technical guidelines.
 



  





 In addition, you will be part of the
 **Lead Developer chapter** 
 , where you will:
 


* Actively drive and participate in improvement projects and ways of working.
* Contribute to coding standards and design patterns.
* Proactively share knowledge and insights across teams.
* Actively work to improve the overall developer experience.
* Assist management in tactical and strategic work.
* Host technical interviews to help grow the team with top talent.



  





**Who you are** 




 You are an experienced software developer with a deep understanding of custom-built applications and strong expertise in AWS, Java SpringBoot microservices, and system design patterns (scalability, resilience, security). You have a strategic mindset when it comes to software architecture and are proficient in DevOps practices like CI/CD. You're analytical, a problem solver, and comfortable managing complex projects, leading teams, and communicating effectively.
 



  





 Self-leadership, time management, and a proactive approach are key attributes of your working style. You lead by example, continuously learn, and are passionate about improving technical excellence within your team. You don’t feel the need to be the most senior developer in the team but are comfortable working with and delegating to more senior technical experts, while contributing code alongside them.
 



  





**Our promise to you** 




*We are better together.* 




 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
 



  





*We support relationships and societies.* 




  





 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
 



  





*We make room for life.* 




  





 Work from home up to two days a week, where your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We also support you through every stage of life with our benefits package.
 



  





*We invite you to a career in motion.* 




  





 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
 



  





**Apply today!** 




 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application!
 



  





 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Anki Snis anki.snis@se.experis.com, +46 70-3775969 and Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
 



  





 Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receive your application!
 



  





**Good to know** 




 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: JavaScript+Node Developer
description:
**Would you like to deal with climate changes during your daily work?**
 Vattenfall is looking for Fullstack Developer to support our Asset IT team. As a team member you will work on contributing to our vision with fossil free living within one generation.
   

  

**What do we do?**
 As a team we are responsible for full software lifecycle. We work in Scrum and we develop distributed, clean, quality software with automated test suite, that we run in cloud environment.
   

  

**What will you do?**
* Build & maintain JavaScript/TypeScript code (write clear, maintainable code)
* Build & maintain business specific application logic within Node APIs
* Work with portals, mobile apps or PWA
* Work with Azure Services
* Release software to Azure PaaS (via Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines)
* Ensure product stability & security


**Location**
 Katowice
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Who are you?**
**As Our Fullstack Developer You Have**
* solid experience in NodeJS (Express), MS SQL (TypeORM)
* experience in working with React Framework
* ability to Write and maintain code using TypeScript
* Redux practical experience
* some experience with Cloud Services
* ability to estimate tasks and keep on promises
* quality focused mindset
* communicative English (used on a daily basis)


**Next To This You Bring As An Advantage**
* hands-on experience in Azure Cloud PaaS components (creating, monitoring, operating)
* hands-on experience in Azure DevOps (Agile Board, CI/CD, WoW)
* experience in working with PWA
* sharing GitHub/projects is a plus


 Additional Information
   

  

**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Marta Jura via marta.jura@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: ROBOTICS APPLICATION ENGINEER
description:
**Company Description** 




 At STILFOLD, we are pioneering a new approach to manufacturing by using the principles of origami to fold flat sheet metal into strong, lightweight structures with minimal waste. Our mission is to replace traditional energy- and tool-intensive production methods with a software-driven platform that embeds sustainability from the initial design decision. Based in Stockholm, we provide AI-powered design software, robotic CAM software, and modular robotic production cells for scalable, local manufacturing. Our innovations result in fewer parts, reduced weight, less material waste, and lower energy consumption. We work with industries like automotive, aerospace, architecture, and mobility infrastructure, and have collaborated with companies such as Volvo, Honda, and Volkswagen.
 



  





**STILFOLD** 

  is seeking a 
 
**Robotics Application Engineer** 

  to join our development team. In this role, you will help push the boundaries of robotics automation systems, integrating them with our next-generation curve folding tool and automation solution. You'll play a key part in advancing the development and functionality of cutting-edge robotic applications.
 




  






 As a key member of the STILFOLD team, you will lead robotics development and act as the vital link between robotic systems and the overall process. Your responsibilities will include overseeing the procurement and installation of industrial manipulators, integrating tooling and sensors, developing new robotic end-effectors as well as developing and maintaining control and safety functions. Additionally, you will work on implementing closed-loop control software for our new manufacturing cells.
 





 To thrive in this role, we believe you are curious and eager to find solutions to challenging problems. A high degree of autonomy and technical experience is required. 
 




  





**BENEFITS** 




  






 ●      Competitive salary backed by collective agreement
 





 ●      Hybrid work policy
 





 ●      Wellness allowance
 





 ●      30 days of paid leave
 





 ●      Modern facilities close to nature
 




  





**WHO YOU ARE** 





 Ideally, you have experience as a robotics engineer, robotics researcher, or automation engineer with a focus on industrial applications. Alternatively, you may be a recent MSc graduate in fields such as control systems or robotic manipulation. You are passionate about tooling and fabrication technologies and enabling new manufacturing technologies by integrating fast-paced advancements in technologies such as artificial intelligence and computational geometry developed by our team.
 




  





**RESPONSIBILITES** 





 ●      Develop, implement and test robot software and robot automation production cells (kinematics, dynamics, controls, etc.)
 





 ●      You will be part of STILFOLD’s R&D team working closely together with mechanical engineer and automation engineer.
 





 ●      Take responsibility for the comprehensive implementation of robotics systems, ensuring all documentation is structured, clear, and maintainable. 
 





 ●      Configure and test field bus networks (CAN, Ethernet, etc.)
 





 ●      Develop custom robot software to interface with third-party sensors and PLCs.
 





 ●      Develop and execute test plans for validation of system integration and safety functionality.
 




  





 QUALIFICATIONS
 




 We consider the following background suitable for this role:
 





 ●      Engineering degree or equivalent in software development software engineering, control engineering applied mathematics, robotics or automation
 





 ●      2+ years’ experience in robotics programming and application development, from ideation to commissioning
 





 ●      Experience in commercial software development in languages such as C++, Python etc.
 





 ●      Experience in integrating industrial sensors and equipment such as vision system
 





 ●      Experience from developing CAD-CAM pipelines for deployment with 6DOF robot manipulators is highly meritorious
 





 ●      PLC programming in TwinCAT or integration with Beckhoff system is merited
 




  






 Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English are mandatory.
 




  






 On a personal level, soft skills are also vital, as you’ll undoubtedly be working with team members across multiple disciplines. We are looking for ambitious people who can:
 





 ●      Solve problems and think critically
 





 ●      Ability to collaborate with others as a member of a team
 





 ●      Adapt to new technologies and processes
 





 ●      Demonstrate leadership and take initiative.
 





 ●      Solve complex problems on schedule with minimal supervision
 




  






 The starting date is expected as soon as possible.
 



-

title: Embedded Systems Engineer
description:
**Embedded Systems Engineer with a Product Development Focus** 




*Primrock is seeking an Embedded Systems Engineer to work in our Stockholm office on our Capacity-as-a-Service offerings for system operators as well as large industrial and commercial electricity end-users.* 




  





**About the role** 




 You will work on both the embedded technology and the overall product experience for our end-users. Your responsibilities include (1) Define the functional requirements of the product based on market and user needs, (2) Hardware-software co-design to ensure feasibility and efficiency, (3) Collaborate with our business development team, (4) Embedded Software Development, (5) Optimize embedded code for real-time execution and reliability, (6) Integrate sensors and power management systems, (7) Work on interfaces and communication protocols, (8) Develop early-stage hardware prototypes using development boards, (9) Design the embedded architecture for performance and scalability, (10) Implement connectivity for remote monitoring/control, (11) Ensure secure software updates over the air and embedded security, (12) Other tasks to create an awesome user experience.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 Education: You have a Master’s Degree in Engineering in a relevant field with excellent academic results from a top school. Language: Professional proficiency in Swedish and English. CEFR Level C2 in both languages is a requirement. Skill set: Embedded Programming, PLCs, Wireless and IoT Communication, Product Development & Prototyping, Power Systems Knowledge including Battery management, inverters, energy optimization, Debugging & Testing.
 



  





**About Primrock** 




 Primrock provides capacity and balance services to the Nordic electricity market. We are a fast-growing company on the edge of the evolving power system in Sweden. Primrock designs, builds, owns and operates physical assets to provide multiple critical services to the electricity market and Nordic synchronous power system. We offer end-users flexible, reliable, and cost-efficient power as-a-service and reserves to the system operator, Svenska kraftnät. We strive to facilitate the transition to a 100% renewable power system by providing distributed solutions as a complement to intermittent generation from solar panels and wind turbines.
 



  





**About the job** 




 The position is full time (100%) at our office in Stockholm (close to Stockholm University). Primrock offers a competitive compensation package. The position will start in September 2025.
 



  





**Application** 




 Application deadline for this job is 31 July 2025 at 18:00 pm (CET). We look forward to your application.

title: .NET-utvecklare
description:

Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**Analytics Engineer**
 Are you passionate about transforming data into insight and impact? Do you thrive at the intersection of analytics, technology, and business? Excited to help shape the future of audio content with reliable and actionable insights? If so, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 As part of our mission at Podme to build joyful and habit-forming listening experiences across the Nordics, we’re looking for a talented Analytics Engineer—with a focus on analytical insight and stakeholder collaboration—to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you’ll work closely with teams across product, marketing, engineering, and beyond, ensuring that our decisions are informed by accurate insights. Your contributions will drive strategic decisions and fuel growth and innovation across our subscription platform.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to make your mark at a fast-growing company where creativity meets data and where podcasts are just the beginning.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Transform and model data to ensure clean, trustworthy, and reusable datasets for reporting and analysis.
* Design and maintain dashboards that track key business, product, and marketing KPIs.
* Collaborate with marketing teams to analyse customer lifecycle data and identify growth opportunities.
* Partner with product and engineering to implement and refine tracking strategies across our platforms.
* Conduct deep-dive analyses to generate insights that shape content and product development.
* Work closely with Data Engineers to set up robust validation checks and resolve data discrepancies proactively.
* Collaborate with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate data needs into actionable solutions.


 What You Bring
   

  

 You’re not just great with data, you know how to make it matter. You love digging into complex data domains, building scalable solutions, and communicating your findings in a way that informs and inspires.
   

  

* Hands-on experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role with a focus on analytics and stakeholder collaboration.
* Strong SQL skills and experience working with cloud data warehouses like BigQuery.
* Experience with dbt and modern data transformation practices.
* Ability to build clear, insightful dashboards in tools like Looker Studio (or similar).
* Understanding of data modeling principles and analytics best practices.
* Strong communicator who can turn complex data into actionable stories for a range of stakeholders.
* Bonus: Familiarity with Python, Airflow, Braze, GA4, or experience in subscription-based media or audio platforms.
* Extra kudos: Familiarity with data privacy regulations.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* A structured thinker who connects data to real-world outcomes.
* A curious mind who asks the right questions and finds answers in the numbers.
* A collaborative communicator who shares insights clearly.
* A problem-solver who blends technical skill with business context.


 Why Join Podme?
   

  

 At Podme, we believe in the power of audio stories to inform, entertain, and inspire. Backed by Schibsted—one of the Nordics’ leading media groups—we’re on a mission to deliver the best of podcasting and beyond to listeners across Sweden, Norway, and Finland.
   

  

* Dynamic Environment: Make an impact at a fast-growing company.
* Supportive Culture: Collaborate with a team that values knowledge-sharing and continuous learning.
* Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy 3-4 days per week in our Stockholm office, balancing flexibility with team connection.
* Wellness Perks: Access healthcare benefits and wellness allowances.
* Premium Content Access: Listen to our exclusive shows–on the house.


 Help us power the Nordic podcast revolution with insight-driven decisions.
   

  

 Your next great challenge starts here.
   

  

 Apply now and let’s build something great together.

title: Senior Systems Programmer
description:
We are looking for a Systems Programmer to join our Central Tech team! This is where our core technology team is based and where we innovate in areas that push the boundaries for what open-world sandbox gaming means as well as improve, optimize and support our existing core technology. In this role, you will work side by side with seasoned professionals with years of experience in developing our proprietary engine and runtime systems. Together, we will design solutions and elevate our engine to new heights!
   

  

**The position**
 As a Systems Programmer at Central Tech, you will help develop, maintain and adapt the lower-level systems of the game such as spawning, memory management, job scheduling, threading framework, frame layout, streaming, and networking interfaces. You will be involved in profiling and optimizing our game as well as assisting with debugging and the design of core systems. You should have a strong sense for developing simple, robust and performant systems. In addition to outstanding technical knowledge, we are looking for a self-motivated individual with strong communication and collaboration skills.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Work with Avalanche’s Central Technology team to develop core technology for our in-house open-world engine.
* Work with our systems to make them as efficient as possible.
* Debug, optimize and iterate our current technology.
* Work closely with the game projects in developing our engine to run on the first-party platforms.
* Support game projects using our in-house engine.


**Who You Are**
* Solid C++ programming experience.
* Excellent in problem-solving and debugging C++ code.
* Knowledge of a wide range of tools and pipelines used in modern game development.
* Strong multi-threaded programming skills.
* Knowledge of a wide range of game-level systems, including scene management, physics, animation, AI, rendering, etc.
* Experienced with automated testing, testable code, and robust test frameworks to ensure stability and performance.
* Have a great attention to detail.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Data Engineer / Cloud Developer within Advanced Analytics
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are now looking for a seasoned developer within Data Engineering to strengthen the Product Analytics team within the Connected Analytics unit. You will be working as part of an agile team to enable various units within TRATON R&D worldwide in accessing comprehensive amounts of connected vehicle data and create data products, self-service analytics and visualizations based on the data of a fleet of several hundred thousand vehicles. As part of the team, you will participate in the short- and long-term planning of deliveries and technologies, the prioritization and according implementation.
   

  

 In your role, you will bring in your competence and efforts to continuously improve and scale the toolset through which we create data availability and insights for the various consumers within TRATON R&D. You will cooperate with data providers and consumers alike (data engineers, data scientists and AI experts, engineers, analysts, statisticians, product and service owners) and develop high quality data products and self-service in a sustainable and scalable way.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Scale up and continuously improve the toolset to enable advanced analytics and data sharing for TRATON R&D
* Develop data products and create insights based on connected vehicle data
* Take ownership for the complete life-cycle of the solutions you create, from requirements, planning, implementation to maintenance and continuous improvements
* Accelerate and scale the team’s efforts by applying latest technologies and methods
* Contribute to the continuous improvement process of the team and share your knowledge to support the journey to being a data-driven and AI-ready company
* Ensure reliable, scalable and cyber secure solutions by applying and continuously improving the team’s DevSecOps methods
* Keep a clear focus on efficiency, managing the balance between cost, customer value and elimination of waste


**Who You Are**
 As a person, you are analytical and communicative. Establishing a personal network within the organization to find the best possible solution to a problem is easy for you. You embrace diversity and cooperation and are experienced in mentoring and leading teams. You have a supportive mindset when engaging stakeholders and consumers of your solutions, and like to put in an extra effort for satisfied customers.
   

  

 In your career, you have worked with large scale data sets and industrial solutions in cloud environments. You show professional habits and skills when it comes to tooling, coding, testing, deploying and documentation. You have a proven track record in at least some of the relevant areas of the field such as cloud data warehouses, data processing, statistics, data science and analytics, data- and ML-pipelining, DevSecOps, cloud infrastructure and agile development.
   

  

 Having worked with operational vehicle data, diagnostic data, geospatial data, or comparable large data sets in similar industries is a merit; as is leadership experience as Scrum Master, Project Lead or similar.
   

  

 Your work is based on the following (or comparable) skills and tooling (examples): Python / SQL / C#, AWS, CICD, Gitlab, Grafana, Snowflake, Databricks, Azure AD, front-end development (e.g. Vue) and visualization, statistics and analytics (e.g. SAS Viya, Power-BI).
   

  

 You have an academic education at university level in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Our unit is part of the Connected Vehicle Data and Analytics section within the Cloud Embedded Platform domain of TRATON R&D, which is the global development organization for the brands Scania and MAN in Europe and the brand International in the US. With our global organization, we deliver innovative and sustainable solutions with the customer value at the heart of everything.
   

  

 The team Product Analytics is part of a line- and flow-organization which is working globally according to SAFe. We ensure that TRATON R&D has access to the data and analytics capabilities needed for informed decision making.
   

  

 Within our organization, we value a culture of collaboration and learning, with respect for the individual. As a member of the team, you have the opportunity to shape your work and the future of the transportation industry with us.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-01. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Frank Deubzer, Group Manager, frank.deubzer@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: IAM Security Engineer
description:
Vi
 *söker nu* 
 en Security Engineer med fokus på IAM/IGA till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som Security Engineer med inriktning på IAM/IGA och åtkomstkontroll får du en nyckelroll i att övervaka, drifta och vidareutveckla Bankgirots säkerhetsplattformar för identitetshantering och autentisering. Du arbetar operativt med lösningar som Active Directory, PAM, MFA, PKI och HSM – med syftet att säkerställa att identitetsflöden, accesshantering och autentisering sker säkert, spårbart och i enlighet med regulatoriska krav.
   

  

 I rollen ingår att samverka med arkitektur- och plattformsområden för att säkerställa effektiva och säkra identitets- och behörighetsflöden samt att stötta verksamheten i tekniska frågor kring access och identitet. Du deltar i säkerhetsgranskningar och revisioner, arbetar med att ansluta applikationer till centrala IDP-lösningar och stödjer automatisering av onboarding/offboarding och övriga IAM-flöden. Du bidrar även till det strategiska förbättringsarbetet av våra kontroller, metoder och dokumentation.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du har en stark säkerhetsmedvetenhet och är van vid att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer där identitets- och åtkomsthantering är en central del av både säkerhets- och compliancearbetet. Med ett strukturerat och analytiskt arbetssätt tar du dig an tekniska utmaningar och bidrar aktivt till förbättringar inom IAM-området.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av teknisk drift och utveckling av IAM-plattformar, inklusive komponenter som Active Directory, PAM, LDAP, MFA, IDP och Access Control. Du har god förståelse för IAM-livscykelhantering, autentisering och olika typer av behörighetsmodeller – och har sannolikt arbetat i miljöer med höga krav på efterlevnad och spårbarhet. Vidare har du kännedom om protokoll som SAML, OIDC, OAuth och WebauthN, samt erfarenhet av federerade identitetslösningar och säker autentisering för API:er. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med lösningar som Curity och Omada, har erfarenhet av automatisering eller skriptning inom IAM samt innehar certifieringar som CISSP, CISM eller GIAC.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Battery Test and Validation Engineer – Battery Systems
description:
**About Us**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact. We are looking for a passionate and experienced Battery test and validation Engineer to join our dynamic team!
   

  

**Position Overview**
 As a Battery Test and Validation Engineer at Echandia Marine, you will be responsible for the planning, execution, and analysis of testing activities for our advanced battery systems. You will play a critical role in validating the performance, reliability, and safety of our battery solutions, ensuring they meet the highest standards for marine applications.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Battery Testing: Lead the planning and execution of advanced testing activities for battery systems, module and cells, ensuring high performance, reliability, and safety.
* Component Validation: Oversee the validation and functional testing of the electrical system and components, including battery management systems (BMS),
* Testing Protocol Development: Develop and implement comprehensive test protocols and procedures to verify system performance, safety, and compliance with industry standards.
* Data Analysis: Perform detailed data analysis, simulations, and reporting to assess and optimize battery system behavior, performance, and efficiency.


**Qualifications**
* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in relevant field.
* Minimum 3–5 years of experience in battery testing, validation, or a closely related field within energy storage or electrical systems.
* Demonstrated experience in developing, executing, and analyzing test plans for cells, modules and battery systems.
* Strong knowledge of battery systems, BMS functionality, power electronics, and electrical safety standards.
* Hands-on experience in executing battery testing, validation procedures, and interpreting test data.
* Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and keen attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills and proven ability to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams.


**What We Offer**
* A dynamic and innovative work environment at the forefront of sustainable technology.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A chance to contribute to the global effort to create a cleaner, more sustainable future.
* Competitive salary and benefits.


 Echandia is challenging the maritime industry with safer electrification. Since its founding in 2018, Echandia has rapidly become a global leader in maritime battery systems, delivering nearly 70 systems for electrification projects worldwide. Our systems are tailored to optimize energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact, supporting the maritime industry’s transition towards sustainable operations. Based in Stockholm, we serve customers across the globe.

title: Mjukvaruarkitekt, Critical Care
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**Tillsammans gör vi skillnad**
 På Getinge är vi engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att rädda liv och säkerställa utmärkt vård. Vi erbjuder innovativa lösningar för operationsrum, intensivvårdsenheter, steriliseringsavdelningar och för Life Science och institutioner. Ett jobb hos Getinge kommer att ge dig karriärmöjligheter som både inspirerar och utmanar.
   

  

**Bli en del av Getinge och forma framtidens intensivvård som senior mjukvaruarkitekt!**
 På Getinge räddar vi liv varje dag – och vi vill dubbla antalet liv vi räddar. Nu utökar vi vårt GUI-utvecklingsteam i Solna för att accelerera utvecklingen av nästa generations produkter inom intensivvård och anestesiologi. Som senior mjukvaruarkitekt får du en nyckelroll i att ta våra världsledande Critical Care-produkter till nya höjder. Är du redo att göra skillnad?
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som senior mjukvaruarkitekt blir du en central del av vårt tvärfunktionella team. Du leder utvecklingen av branschledande mjukvara och driver innovativa lösningar för komplexa utmaningar inom connectivity och cybersäkerhet. Genom att samarbeta med produktchefer, systemarkitekter och ingenjörer bidrar du med din expertis till att skapa säkra, tillförlitliga och banbrytande produkter som räddar liv.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter**
* Leda och designa mjukvaruarkitektur för säkerhetskritiska system genom hela produktlivscykeln.
* Stötta teamet med din systemkunskap, teknikkunskap och vision om framtiden.
* Utveckla robusta lösningar för inbyggda system baserade på Linux och C++.
* Driva front-end-utveckling i Qt och säkerställa hög kvalitet genom automatiserad testning.
* Samarbeta med andra team för att möta krav inom connectivity, functional safety och cybersäkerhet.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi Söker Dig Som Brinner För Teknisk Innovation Och Vill Göra Skillnad i En Livsviktig Bransch. Du Har
   

  

* Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande.
* Ca 10 års erfarenhet av inbyggda system med Linux och C++.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av front-end-utveckling i QT.
* Kunskap inom automatiserad testning och kontinuerliga leveranser.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetskritiska system och relevanta standarder, gärna inom medicinteknik.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Som person är du en engagerad lagspelare som trivs med att fatta tekniska beslut i en dynamisk miljö. Du motiveras av att arbeta med avancerade system där funktionalitet och tillförlitlighet är avgörande. Hos oss får du utrymme att växa, ta ansvar och bidra med idéer i en kultur som präglas av samarbete, kvalitet och innovation.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En möjlighet att påverka livsviktig vårdteknik och rädda liv globalt.
* Ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensationspaket med förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag och familjestöd.
* En lärandekultur med fokus på din utveckling och karriär, med stöd från engagerade ledare.
* En öppen och inkluderande arbetsmiljö med gemensamma aktiviteter och stark teamkänsla.


 Vi är
 **Team Players** 
 ,
 **Forward Thinkers** 
 och
 **Game Changers** 
 – och vi vill ha dig med på resan!
   

  

**Ansök nu!**
 Skicka din ansökan senast den 15e Augusti via vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på "Ansök nu". På grund av semesterperioden vill vi informera om att vi granskar ansökning med start i V.32 och att svar på mejl kan dröja. På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

**Frågor?** 
 Kontakta rekryterande chef Markus Kihlén ( markus.kihlen@getinge.com ) eller rekryterare Sofia Ekstrand ( sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com ).
   

  

**Följ med oss på resan mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade MedTech-företag!**

title: Automation / Project Engineer - 800xA system to AFRY
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 🌟 Join AFRY’s Automation West – Shape the Future of Industrial Engineering
   

  

 👥 About Automation West
   

  

 Automation West is a specialized unit within AFRY’s Advanced Automation division, home to over 80 experienced engineers. We deliver complete industrial automation and power engineering solutions — from concept development to commissioning — across a wide range of industries.
   

  

 ⚙️ What We Do
   

  

* Deliver advanced automation and electrical engineering projects
* Serve clients in petrochemicals, automotive, healthcare, and more
* Provide expert automation support across AFRY’s business areas
* Lead and collaborate on projects throughout the Nordic region


 🌍 AFRY at a Glance
   

  

* Founded in 1895, listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange
* Strong presence across the Nordics and global reach
* 1,000+ automation engineers within AFRY
* Projects spanning pharma, food & beverage, energy, pulp & paper, water & wastewater, and infrastructure


 💡 Why Work With Us?
   

  

* Contribute to impactful, high-tech engineering projects
* Join a collaborative, inclusive, and forward-thinking team
* Enjoy a vibrant workplace culture with social activities through Club AFRY
* Grow in an environment that values innovation, development, and work-life balance


 📈 We’re Growing – Come Grow With Us
   

  

 We’re looking for curious, driven, and passionate individuals who want to make a difference in the future of industry. Whether you're an experienced engineer or early in your career, we offer opportunities to learn, lead, and thrive.
   

  

 👉
 **Ready to take the next step?** 
 We’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 🔗 Learn more and apply at www.afry.com
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 🚀 Automation Engineer – Help Us Modernize the Process Industry!
   

  

**Are you ready to shape the future of industrial automation?**
 At Advanced Automation, we’re expanding our investment in modernizing the process industry using ABB 800xA. We deliver cutting-edge automation solutions and lifecycle services across a wide range of industries – from pharmaceuticals and food to energy, mining, and infrastructure.
   

  

 We’re now looking for
 **Automation Engineers with experience in ABB 800xA** 
 to join our growing and highly skilled team!
   

  

 💡 What You’ll Do:
   

  

* Design and program automation systems for process applications
* Work in project teams delivering complete solutions – from field devices to monitoring and control
* Support customers in developing application and HMI (Human Machine Interface) standards
* Migrate systems from AC450 to AC800M using AFRY Quality Tool
* Perform application and system testing, including FAT and SAT
* Assist with on-site installation and commissioning of control systems
* Tune control systems post-startup and follow up with operators and technical staff
* Install and configure system networks, servers, and communication equipment
* Contribute to the development of AFRY’s engineering optimization tools
* Troubleshoot technical issues and build strong customer relationships


 🌍 Location Flexibility – We Want to Hear from You!
   

  

 We have offices across Sweden and are flexible with your location, you are joining a team of around 80 talented automation professionals – and we’d love for you to be one of them!
   

  

 ✅ We’re Looking for Someone Who:
   

  

* Has hands-on experience with ABB 800xA
* Is curious, solution-oriented, and enjoys working closely with customers
* Thrives in a role that blends technology, teamwork, and innovation


 🎯 Ready to Take the Next Step?
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to connect – no matter where you’re currently based. Apply now and become part of a company that’s truly investing in the future of automation!
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Education:**
* A Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Computer Science, or Software Engineering.


**Professional Experience:**
* 5–7 years of experience working with control systems.
* Familiarity with ABB systems such as 800xA, AC500, AC800M, and safety systems is a strong advantage.
* Proven experience in control system electrical and infrastructure design, including networking, fieldbuses, and I/O loop diagrams.


**Skills and Competencies:**
* Strong communication and customer relationship skills.
* Analytical, problem-solving mindset with a goal-oriented approach.
* Eagerness to learn and take on new challenges.
* Ability to work independently and make decisions under pressure.
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Industry experience in pulp and paper, or metal and mining processes.
* Familiarity with ABB 800xA P&P and RMC Libraries.
* Certifications in:
+ System Health Check
+ High Integrity / SIL programming
+ Cybersecurity

* Strong IT skills, particularly in Microsoft Windows environments.
* Knowledge of OS virtualization (e.g., VMware, Citrix), and industrial communication protocols such as OPC, OPC/UA, ODBC.
* Experience with Windows configuration, system administration, and networking fundamentals.
* Understanding of industrial networks and protocols including IEC61850, Modbus RTU/TCP, Profibus, and Profinet.
* Experience with ABB Software – AC400 Advant Master Engineering.


**Ytterligare information**
 Please see https://afry.com/sites/default/files/2022-01/ABB%20Automation%20Specialist%20Services.pdf for more information about our work with system ABB 800xA.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! We will go through applications continuously during the application period. Last application date is 2025-08-30.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Mikael Esberg – Segment Manager, Automation West
   

  

 mikael.j.esberg@afry.com
   

  

 +46 10 505 09 99
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

 ✅ We’re Looking for Someone Who:
   

  

* Has hands-on experience with ABB 800xA
* Is curious, solution-oriented, and enjoys working closely with customers
* Thrives in a role that blends technology, teamwork, and innovation


 🎯 Ready to Take the Next Step?
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to connect – no matter where you’re currently based. Apply now and become part of a company that’s truly investing in the future of automation!
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Education:**
* A Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Computer Science, or Software Engineering.


**Professional Experience:**
* 5–7 years of experience working with control systems.
* Familiarity with ABB systems such as 800xA, AC500, AC800M, and safety systems is a strong advantage.
* Proven experience in control system electrical and infrastructure design, including networking, fieldbuses, and I/O loop diagrams.


**Skills and Competencies:**
* Strong communication and customer relationship skills.
* Analytical, problem-solving mindset with a goal-oriented approach.
* Eagerness to learn and take on new challenges.
* Ability to work independently and make decisions under pressure.
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Industry experience in pulp and paper, or metal and mining processes.
* Familiarity with ABB 800xA P&P and RMC Libraries.
* Certifications in:
+ System Health Check
+ High Integrity / SIL programming
+ Cybersecurity

* Strong IT skills, particularly in Microsoft Windows environments.
* Knowledge of OS virtualization (e.g., VMware, Citrix), and industrial communication protocols such as OPC, OPC/UA, ODBC.
* Experience with Windows configuration, system administration, and networking fundamentals.
* Understanding of industrial networks and protocols including IEC61850, Modbus RTU/TCP, Profibus, and Profinet.
* Experience with ABB Software – AC400 Advant Master Engineering.


**Ytterligare information**
 Please see https://afry.com/sites/default/files/2022-01/ABB%20Automation%20Specialist%20Services.pdf for more information about our work with system ABB 800xA.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! We will go through applications continuously during the application period. Last application date is 2025-08-30.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Mikael Esberg – Segment Manager, Automation West
   

  

 mikael.j.esberg@afry.com
   

  

 +46 10 505 09 99
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Översättare Engelska till Svenska - AI Tränare
description:
DataAnnotation är engagerade i att skapa kvalitativ AI. Gå med i vårt team för att hjälpa till att träna AI-chatbotar samtidigt som du får flexibiliteten att arbeta på distans och välja ditt eget schema.
 



  





 Vi söker en tvåspråkig professionell för att gå med i vårt team och lära chatbotar. Du kommer att ha samtal på både svenska och engelska med chatbotar för att mäta deras framsteg, samt skriva nya samtal för att lära dem vad de ska säga.
 



  





**Förmåner:** 



* Detta är en heltids- eller deltidsdistansposition.
* Du kommer att kunna välja vilka projekt du vill arbeta med.
* Du kan arbeta efter eget schema.
* Projekt betalas per timme, med start från 30+ USD per timme, samt bonusar för högkvalitativt och högvolymarbete.



  





**Ansvarsområden (både på svenska och engelska):** 



* Komma på olika samtal inom en rad ämnen.
* Skriva högkvalitativa svar när specifika instruktioner ges.
* Jämföra prestanda för olika AI-modeller.
* Forska och faktagranska AI-svar.



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Flytande i svenska och engelska.
* En kandidatexamen (avslutad eller pågående).
* Utmärkta skriv- och grammatikfärdigheter.
* Stark forsknings- och faktagranskningsförmåga för att säkerställa noggrannhet och originalitet.



  





**Not: Betalning sker via PayPal. Vi kommer aldrig att be om några pengar från dig. PayPal hanterar alla valutakonverteringar från USD.**
